story:
Would you like to see my novel among the new sci fi novels 2018?

I am a science fiction thriller writer Emre Ata living in Turkey. I am writing my books in turkish. I have no economic power to translate my novels from Turkish into English. So I have been postponing this dream for 8 years. Will you sponsor me for translation? I need need financial support  for translate my novels Turkish into English. Thank you Emre

-------------Update 09.01.2018------------------

Hi friends, this is my 2nd indiegogo video. My friends told me to make more striking videos. I made this amusing video in an amateurish way. My goal is to be able to attract attention only.

 

My goal.

1. Turn the my first science fiction novel into English.
2. Publishing the science-fiction novel through amazon kindly.

Thank you.

I hope the video has fun for you.

----------- UPDATE ------  24.12.2017

Dear friends, I'm trying to keep it short. I'll explain it to you in more detail. I have postponed my 8 year science fiction novel dream. there is a dreamer who will be a minimum of 6 books. But there is no financial power. So I can not claim English translation support for 6 books. The first science fiction novel is over. My novels are 300 - 450 pages long. This is very expensive. My books are about humanity, space, space exploration, technology and technology in our world. My novels about A science fiction thriller adventure. I have been trying to reach the founding fiction foundations for 2 months, but these foundations are only gentle to me in support of the promotion. That's why I'm here to help me publish my first novel as an e-book. After I publish my first novel, I am confident that a scientist or at a book house will support me.I want to see my first science fiction novel among the newly released 2018 sci fi ranks.


A 300 - 400 page novel from Turkish to English translation and editing fees :3300 - 4100 Dolar

6 300- 400 page from Turkish to English translation and editing fees : 18.000 -20.000 dolar

Would you like to see my novel among the new sci fi novels 2018?

But I believe a publishing company will reach me after I publish my first novel. So it's enough to support me for my first novel.

Emre

story:
Short Summary

I have been writing more or less my whole life, whether about my dreams of walking on another planet's surface or my own take on the adventures of my childhood heroes (as seen on Star Trek, Doctor Who or old Superman comics). As I grew older my interest in original stories grew (due to some urging from primary school teachers) and I began working on concepts for a novel in Grade 9. 

"The Last Seven Days" has been constantly evolving and changing since then. At first it was a comical superhero romp called "The Diamond Dogs" (the David Bowie references didn't end there) starring three teenagers on a quest to save the world. Since then it has evolved into a much more complex tale, for a time taking the form of a 100'000 word-long two part novel named "Nucleus", which was ultimately split in half to form "The Last Seven Days" and it's prospective follow-up, which is currently unnamed. 

"The Last Seven Days" is about 80'000 words long. It details the friendships of the four teenagers as well as the increasingly hostile situations they face, and focuses on themes of trust, friendship and morality. 

What Is Needed? 

The world of publishing is a somewhat daunting one, and because of this I have opted for self publishing, which presents itself with its own challenges. The world of self-publishing is not a cheap one, which makes a lot of sense really given the number of things that need attending to before the book reaches the shelves (or e-book stores for that matter). This being said, there are many expenses that need covering to get this book out into the open, including:

  • Printing costs for both hardcover and paperback editions
  • Distribution to stores, both online and in-store
  • Copyright registration
  • Editor's fee
  • Cover design fee
  • Promotional fees

Given that it is no small feat publishing a novel whilst attending university, I would be hugely grateful for any help you may be able to send me in getting this novel out into the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be hugely appreciated if you could spread the word and get this out there by sharing on social media platforms. Publishing a novel is not an easy task, and I would be extremely grateful for all the support that you can give. 

Now... let's go publish a novel!

story:
Short Summary

Се работи за две историографски дела напишани во средината на XI век, кои го опфаќаат времето од создавањето на светот до 1079 година. Впрочем Кедрин ги раскажува настаните од создавањето на светот до зацарувањето на Исаакиј Комнин (1057 г.), а Скилица пак, настаните од 811 до 1079, при што за периодот од 811 до 1057 Кедрин во својот Compendium го превзема текстот на Скилица дословно, и поради тоа е општо прифатено двете овие дела да се издаваат заедно под заеднички наслов, со оглед на тоа што во науката сеуште постои расправа дали Кедрин се служел со Скилица или обратно. Овие дела опфаќаат настани од старохебрејската, античката (хеленската и римската) и почетокот на средновековната историја, а особено е значајно за светската историја што содржат делови кои зборуваат за Хазарите после падот на Атил (престолнина на Хазарите од VIII до X век) што во другите пишани извори е многу ретко.

За Република Македонија, и за нашата историска наука, образованието, но и културата воопшто, овие дела имаат преголемо значење, особено поради фактот што се најважниот пишан извор за Самуиловата средновековна држава и настаните кои се во непосредна врска со неа. Критичко пак, издание на превод на овие дела од старогрчки на македонски литературен јазик е и тоа како неопходно (непостоењето имено, на било каков превод на овие дела на македонски јазик, до ден денес преставува голем недостаток и хендикеп за нашите истражувачи).

Нашиот превод е работен според грчкиот текст, со паралелен осврт и на латинскиот текст, во изданието на Migne, J. -P., Patrologiae Cursus Completus, Series Graeca, Compendium historiarum, PG 121, col. 23- 1166 и PG 122, col. 9- 367 & Excerpta ex breviario historico, PG 122, col. 368- 478 (Paris, 1894).

story:
The quick summary

Firstly, if you cannot help, please don't fret. I know exactly what it is like to be short on funds. I've been there since maybe 1990. And this campaign explicitly betrays the hollow state of my coffers. But if you cannot help, I do ask that you pass on this campaign to someone you know who can help or might just be interested in reading my story.

Second, I'm doing this as a 28-day funder, because monies can be delayed getting to me for up to 15 days after the campaign end and I'm on a very tight schedule -- I have to leave for Ireland on July 9 in order for this all to come together. And since I'm doing this as a fixed campaign, not a flexible one, I won't receive a dime unless this is fully funded - if it doesn't hit, you get your pledge back, in full.

I've been invited to read fiction in Bantry, Ireland at the West Cork Literary Festival, which, in part, will occasion the launch of a book from Fish Publishing in which I will be published. My story, as one of the top 10 from 1285 global entries (yep, less than 1% were winners) will be put into good 'ole paper form alongside dozens of other writers who also placed in the various contests that Fish holds each year in fiction and poetry. They were nice enough to invite me, along with the other finalists, but it is up to me to spring for the trip. During this festival, many agents and publishers and writers and book lovers are in attendance and I'm hoping to take the manuscript of the novel I'm working on (read below) and pass it on to a few parties who might fall in love with it. 

I've set up perks off to the right as specific incentives for this campaign, but you have the ability to contribute any other amount you'd like just for the heck of it. Want to send me a million bucks? Go for it. I'll contact you after I pick myself up off the floor. If you think the perks would be interesting to someone you know, buy one as a gift for a writer friend or family member.

What follows is the whole lowdown on why I've set up this crowdfunder. It's unlike me to do this because I find it difficult to ask for assistance when there are plenty of other people and causes to reward. But this opportunity is, without question, one of the most important things that has (nearly) happened to me. Will you help me get rid of the nearly?

1. My story

I've always wanted a mentor, a fiction writer of some acclaim who would take me under his or her wing to guide me on the creative journey I've taken as my life's calling. This is something that really no longer occurs and hasn't in traditional terms for many many decades, at least within the realm of fiction writing. So, I write in a vacuum and read a great deal to find mentors on my bookshelves. I'm hoping that as you read a bit about what I am trying to do with this campaign to ask for your hard-earned money that you each become a virtual mentor to me through your generosity. Nothing would mean more than to know that the people who support me now do so because they believe there is a wispy possibility that my stories have staying power.

I've been writing for a long time -- I remember penning stories when I was about ten years old. So, that makes it nearly 37 years that I have been trying to craft fiction that someone will read and find a bit of value in. I'll keep doing it till the day I die because I find great joy in it and a way for me to engage with the world that truly feels worthwhile.

I've had my share of minor successes --- two dozen small publications in the last ten years, but it is only recently that the tide is slowly turning my way. 

A summary of recent high points with my writing that have given me some much needed hope to press on.

First - The story that placed in the Fish Publishing contest, as I wrote about above.

Second - Last year I placed in a contest held by a journal called Sixfold. This is a contest in which fellow entrants read and judge your story for advancement through three rounds. So, if your story went through to the 3rd round, it was read by around 60 writers cumulatively. My story, Permaville, is one that I entered into two times in Sixfold (they hold the contest three or four times  year) and honed it with each previous failure. Fortunately, I received ongoing commentary throughout the year that helped illuminate the story's strengths and weaknesses. On this last successful round, I receive the type of comments and feedback that writers dream of when crafting a story in their writing caves. Many of the comments on the story echoed a feeling I'd long held about the piece -- that it could likely be turned into a novel. So, that is what I've been concentrating on for the best part of the last half year. I'm on my way with it and think it will take another six months or so to have a working, complete manuscript that might be salable both as a novel and as a possible movie. Part of my trip to Cork will be doling out hardcopy manuscripts of 50 pages of the novel to agents and editors who will be present at the festival. It will provide me a good chance to take advantage of both a captive and kindred audience. Who knows what could happen if the right person takes a liking to my story?

Third - This year I won the inaugural contest for writers that the Tempe Public Library sponsored. My category was Adult Fiction and I won for a story called Spare Parts (read it here). The video at the beginning of this page is me reading in front of a 100+ people who attended the reading on April 1. Fortunately, my cousin Michael happened to be in town with his wife and kids on a vacation. He's a professional documentary filmmaker and offered to tape my reading. He's very good at what he does and I was so thankful to have this event now permanently recorded.

Winning this contest was a total surprise and gave me the kind of energy I cannot recall ever receiving during my life as a writer. I took a chance to submit a short story that I loved and had worked hard on but wasn't really sure had any legs. The honor of being chosen by local peers is immeasurable. The two leaders of this effort - Jill Brenner, Adult Services Librarian at the Tempe Public Library and Jeanne Hanrahan, Liaison, University Academic Success Programs Administration at ASU - put in a herculean effort to ensure that this first-ever event was a rousing success.

I was honored to learn that I am part of a community of writers that is passionate, devoted, and runs from high-school age to retirees. Tempe has some serious writing talent.

2. How much is it going to cost? The breakdown

The straight poop on how much money it will take to make this trip possible and not return with the kind of throat-clenching stress that makes me wonder why on earth I ever went in the first place.

Airfaire from Phoenix to Shannon - $1700

Bus fares from Shannon to Bantry and back; and public transport while in Bantry for the week - $200

Hotel or Airbnb - $1000 for 8 nights (not sure which yet, but pricing is equivalent)

Sustenance - $250

Indiegogo Expenses (transfer fees, wire fees, their cut) - $500

Mobile phone premium charges while overseas - $100 (as much texting as possible, as little calling)

Two Guinnesses per day, with proper tips (it's Ireland, folks) - $100

Miscellaneous incidentals (I haven't a clue yet, but they always arise, don't they?) - $500

Approximately 1/2 of the wages I'll miss while gone for half a month - (this will partially help me avoid the above-mentioned throat-clenching stress)- $650

Total - $5000

If it pans out beyond my expectations, each $500 that I hit above the goal will allow me to devote a minimum of 40 hours per week exclusively to finishing the manuscript of my novel, which ultimately would help me take a real stab at securing an agent (maybe the one I met in Bantry) and making a real go at being a working creative writer.

Also, though I'm not going nuts here and figuring tax implications into this, next year this money I raise will be counted as income and be taxed similarly as my current freelance work. So, next year I'll be paying in the vicinity of $1,000 to $2,000 in taxes on this. There is no way around this and no way for me to avoid it, but I'm not going to outthink the process and try to figure taxes into the funds I'm seeking. I consider this opportunity worthy of the tax burden next year.


3. What I do now (aka, Why I need your help)

I work as a freelance writer, primarily composing resumes for people in a variety of industries. I also work as an editor and take on any job that comes my way involving improved written communication. I work as a contract worker, so pay all taxes out of my own pocket. This includes a hefty self-employment tax each year. For every dollar I earn, at the end of the taxes and incidentals, I keep about 65 cents. So, it is a tight living. And especially when this living is unsteady. In the last year alone, I've gone three sets of 2-4 weeks with zero income because of lack of work. It gets dry sometimes.

I live frugally - not much, if anything, is left at the end of each month with school loans and monthly living expenses and credit card debt and car insurance and fixits (when the car works) and medical expenses out of pocket (I can't yet afford to pay insurance premiums - dental yes, but medical is a few hundred extra per month). The most luxurious thing I do lately is coffee out - this is primarily for me to reengage with human beings after writing resumes and my own fiction for upwards of 12 hours a day, seven days a week.

Thank you

I really appreciate the time you've taken to read the story of my campaign.

If you're going to become a contributor, welcome aboard.

If not, cheers for reading this and for passing it on to someone you know who may be interested in helping out.

There is no way around this and no way for me to avoid it, but I'm not going to outthink the process and try to figure taxes into the funds I'm seeking. I consider this opportunity worthy of the tax burden next year.


3. What I do now (aka, Why I need your help)



I work as a freelance writer, primarily composing resumes for people in a variety of industries. I also work as an editor and take on any job that comes my way involving improved written communication. I work as a contract worker, so pay all taxes out of my own pocket. This includes a hefty self-employment tax each year. For every dollar I earn, at the end of the taxes and incidentals, I keep about 65 cents. So, it is a tight living. And especially when this living is unsteady. In the last year alone, I've gone three sets of 2-4 weeks with zero income because of lack of work. It gets dry sometimes.


I live frugally - not much, if anything, is left at the end of each month with school loans and monthly living expenses and credit card debt and car insurance and fixits (when the car works) and medical expenses out of pocket (I can't yet afford to pay insurance premiums - dental yes, but medical is a few hundred extra per month). The most luxurious thing I do lately is coffee out - this is primarily for me to reengage with human beings after writing resumes and my own fiction for upwards of 12 hours a day, seven days a week.

Thank you I really appreciate the time you've taken to read the story of my campaign.
If you're going to become a contributor, welcome aboard.
If not, cheers for reading this and for passing it on to someone you know who may be interested in helping out.

story:
Are you eating the "cat food?"

Are you a Christian but you're in a rut? Do feel that you are spinning your proverbial wheels? Maybe you're a new Believer, or your spiritual life has left the tracks, or you are are just trying to understand the world around you. Nobody ever promised the Christian life would be easy, but we were promised something called an "abundant life." Sadly, however, few of us ever actually take it. If this describes you, perhaps Don't Eat the Cat Food! is for you. 

Don't Eat the Cat Food! is about expanding our horizons and tuning our spiritual antennae to the frequency of the Creator, who is urgently trying to get our attention. God speaks through nature, through events, through our fellow human beings, and most potently through his timeless Word. But in the frantic pace of our daily lives, we can miss out on the joy we're supposed to have, and instead live lives of unfulfilled potential. But that's not what God wants from us! Remember how he called the disciples? He calls you and me, too! We could be living full, exciting lives on the edge, chasing after the only treasure worth pursuing: a fuller, deeper relationship with our Creator, characterized by obedience to -- and dependence upon -- Jesus Christ.

Why I wrote the book

As a believer, I had never really doubted there is a God, and that he loved me, had plans for me and would see me through the trials. But still, I had to find him again after a career change. My (and my family's) journey past the edge of the proverbial map illustrated something important that I should have remembered all along: God would provide. And he has.

We all see the world (as Paul said) "Through a mirror, darkly." But we must try to understand the one who created us. God is vastly different than we are, has a different worldview, and runs things differently from the way we would. All the resources of this vast universe are his to command. And because he loves us so much and gave us a way to reconcile ourselves to him through Christ, we are forever in his debt. He offered to lift us up out of the clay and promised us a life abundant and full.

Sadly, though, many of us wander through this world like lost children, just trying to find our way back home. We grab onto things that we think will bring us security and peace, but they're just flimsy illusions, making us oblivious to the larger universe outside.

Although the book is written by a Christian, for my fellow Christians,  open-hearted seekers can also find something to appreciate, to help them understand some basic things about God, and how he provides for us.

Lending her considerable talents to illustrating this book is Sherry Phillips Carlson, whose beautiful and evocative images are inspired by Southern coastal and home traditions. I am honored to be working with Sherry on this project. 

Risks, Challenges & Rewards

We need to raise enough funding to get Don't Eat the Cat Food! published and distributed. We've chosen to publish through WestBow Press, a self-publishing arm of HarperCollins Christian Publishing (which owns Thomas Nelson and Zondervan). To publish, market and distribute will take at least $5,000.

All gifts will be tithed upon. At least 10 percent of the gross proceeds from the project will go to a wonderful organization called But God Ministries, supporting work in Haiti.

Some have asked what will happen if we don't raise the goal. The answer is nothing. In the event that we don't raise the full amount needed, your contribution will be refunded, and we will figure out another way to publish the book.

Here is our budget (assuming we raise $5,000):

  1. Tithe: $500.00. This represents our commitment to give back a portion of what we have been given. 10% of all receipts will be given to But God Ministries, helping care for people in Haiti.
  2. Crowdfunding Expenses: $450.00. Indiegogo (consistent with most other crowdfunding sites) charges a fee of 5%, plus variable fees which probably add up to about 4%, for a total of 9%. (This is a loose estimate.)
  3. Publication: $1,999.00 (plus tax). Westbow Press will be doing the actual publication, from editing to design of the book itself, as well as marketing and getting the book to distribution points.
  4. Taxes: $1,000.00. Uncle Sam will get his share. Amounts donated to a crowdfunding campaign are taxable. The actual amount will vary, but we're setting aside 20% to be on the safe side.
  5. Order fulfillment, marketing, and support: $1,051.00. That money will be used to buy and ship books, fulfill our perk obligations and get the word out about the book.
Anything left from $5,000 goal will be placed into an account to defray project-related expenses. 

 Other Ways You Can Help

All gifts will be appreciated. We realize that not everybody will be able to contribute to this campaign. But you can spread the word. There are some social media tools here on Indiegogo that you can use to tell others. 

Thank you for reading this appeal, and for prayerfully considering supporting Don't Eat the Cat Food!

Anything left from $5,000 goal will be placed into an account to defray project-related expenses.

story:
"If he is right --he will not only revolutionize a sector-- he will probably change the design of our cities." - RTL TV

"He is a little rebel in the energy field, who doesn't care about the power lobby" - SWR TV

Kill the Game Changer is an illustrated book with unveiled images and unlocked documents of my project RAWLEMON --that have been wildfire across the internet in the last few years-- to establish transparent solar power robots in the field of energy.

WHAT MAKES THIS BOOK AND THIS CAMPAIGN AWESOME?

A few things about the REMATCH:

IF YOU LIKE OUR PLANET:

My friend and my hidden friends: it is as awesome at it looks as a sci-fi novel, but it's a running never-ending story in real time on a key market and to tackle climate change. Now you're playing the character of the most important investor --in the field of energy-- for the welfare of the citizen. Also unlike a supporter for micro financing - - you get to fight CRACKERS and HACKERS. With ALGORITHMS over social media networks. Be the loveliest HACKER on the PLANET and save together a patent that can change the world!


IF YOU HATE OUR PLANET BUT STILL YOU HAVE TO LIVE ON HIM:

You won't hate him anymore. Honest! This is a great documentary --guiding you step by step straight towards the SUN-- in a friendly illustrated format. If you ever have wondering what people's motivations were in the play of ENERGY, you will totally understand why OIL, COAL, NUCLEAR, GAS is the greatest resource to be the most powerful GAMER on the planet. But I'll warn you: ENERGY GAMER are soft players with stunning hardware effects. So if you want to see the secret path of the GAME, you can enter as a GHOST (Ghosts don't die! Shakespeare wrote this and Ryan North did an amazing update on this) on your own adventure.


IF YOU HAVE NO INTEREST IN PLANETARY AT ALL BUT LIKE FUNNY JOKES:

Then I can assure you this book is still totally awesome and chock full of those things you like. I've selected some comments out of thousands that are taking crazy directions with the story. You can love or hate it. This book is written full of inventions to play with GIANTS and TECHNOLOGIES at day and night, and you can enter at this point as the NUCLEAR POPE.


IF YOU DON'T LIKE BOOKS AT ALL BUT CAMPAIGN SPECIALS:

Then you can do something very special within the duration of this CAMPAIGN. Your JOB is to find the POPE and to offer him my PATENT RIGHTS as a GIFT. I will be amazed to give him the rights to tackle the CLIMATE CHANGE tomorrow.


TELL ME MORE ABOUT THE BOOK!

The book itself is already written up to the end of milestone ONE. 40,000 words of stunning industrial comedy and havoc recovered documents that I lovingly crafted together myself over the past year. Milestone one covers round about half time of the whole story and finish in New York City at the 23th level at Wall Street with an important MESSAGE -- that opens book two with milestone TWO. And soon, thanks to your help this book one will be available in an edited and professional polished version -- ready to be sent to the printers.

We are going to decide how amazing this book is going to be and how we polish book TWO. As it is a never-ending story, the more money we raise, the better the books will be. Digital, Paperbacks and hardcovers are given, but we'll also be adding pictures and documents. And not just any pictures and documents: Unveiled pictures from the project and powerful documents of powerful people and organization’s. Look at all these amazing people from book ONE:


- Elon Musk (SpaceX, Tesla, Solar City)
- Bre Pettis (Makerbot)
- Russ Jones (Boeing)
- David Gull (SOM architects)
- Dr. Johannes Lambertz (RWE Power AG)
- Martin Pfund (Siemens)
- Pitz-Pahl (German Aerospace Center (DLR))
- Alfred Braatz (Daimler Benz)
- Karl-Heinz Florenz (European Parliament)
- Ralf Fücks (Heinrich Böll Foundation)
- Werner Platzer, Hans-Martin Henning, Helen Rose (Fraunhofer Society)
- Minister Remmel (Germany)

- Haibach (Schott)
- James P. Clark (The WTN)
- Thomas Schlenker (Schüco)
- Eric Marlo (Starwood Hotels)
- Jeremy Scahill (Tails)
- Loic Mahe (Saint Gobain)
- David Prous (Gas Natural)
- Kate Mc Kinnon (KateMcKinnon)
- Volker Quaschning (HTW Berlin)
- Jesus Ballestrin (Plataforma Solar de Almeria)
- Climate-KIC
- Jan-Hinnerk Pleis (Volkswagen AG)
- Taylor (Kickstarter)
...and more!

And my heroes from Milestone one:

- Rodrigo Caula (Designboom)
- Tracy Staetder (Discovery Channel)
- Mindy Katzmen (MSN)
- Cris Welch (The Verge)
- Heiko Schwarzburger (Photovoltaik)
- Eric Kantor (The Suit Magazine)
- Jason Dean (PV Insider)
and
Fastcoexist, Inhabitat, Treehugger, PSKV, Techhive, Endgadget, Geeksaresexy, Repsol...and more!

The LOCATIONS and playgrounds of book one are BARCELONA, BERLIN, DÜSSELDORF, MUNICH and NEW YORK CITY including an interview at the old headquarters of KICKSTARTER.To continue in book two with VIENNA, TAIPEI, LONDON, BERLIN, PARIS, KARLSRUHE and ZURICH.


HOW WILL YOUR MONEY BE USED?

If we reach our goal for the book, I'll be able to release the book as a professionally --edited, translated, layout and designed-- printed volume ready to ship. And the more money we raise, the more pictures and documents are added.
The book ONE will be published with help from Axel Springer Verlag, who have a proven track record in bringing awesome into the real world. For every 5K we raise, I'll post another section from the book and at least one document translated (many documents are written in German language). If we crazy raise more money what's needed, we will unlock amazing things that automatically applied to people who have already contributed!

22th February 2014 - A sphere for the energy transition

THE REWARDS

All backers will have their name printed in the book of your choice as a huge thank you for your support!

Every reward level gets you a DRM-free digital download of book ONE or TWO or both. €15 is all it takes to get one! If you want to contribute more, there are bundles, some fun things and a giant poster as an add on. For those that are interested to empower their home by the sun, you'll find a limited reward at the end.

"Moonpower" - 24" x 36" printed on premium semigloss (170gsm).


FAQ

What about shipping?

Shipping is always tricky as rates differ and change over time but we estimate that it will cost 10 USD within the US and Europe (UK, Portugal, Spain, France, Italy, Austria, Germany, Netherlands and Belgium) and 15 USD to the rest of the World. We can’t know yet if the oil price is stable, but we’ll look forward to archive the best rates for you.

What you are mean with havoc recovered documents?

These documents are recovered or printed copies of any kind of digital communication from the past of the project. Those will be inserted as an inlay in the book. Later on you can use it as a communication template for any kind of business --from the craftsmen up to the ministries. You will find documents for inquire subsidies and how you can grant the copyrights (for e.g. your package design) from Apple, Google, Samsung, Chevrolet, Segway, Mercedes Benz and many more without paying any cent.

story:
Short Summary

Most of us are familiar with a few snapshots from Scottish history. Characters like Mary Queen of Scots and William Wallace crop up time and again alongside key events such as the Glencoe Massacre or Culloden. However, the broad brush of Scotland's history gets a lot less exposure and many remarkable events and fascinating lifestyles go largely unexplored.

This project aims to make it straightforward and enjoyable to get a grasp on how the overall story fits together and explores highlights just waiting to be dragged out into the open. The content sets out to make more of Scotland's story highly accessible by presenting the past through lashings of colour artwork; very readable, relatively short accounts; and focusing on events which brought change. As a Scottish historian, experienced content developer and contract university lecturer, I'm trained for the work involved and a sizeable share of the heavy lifting has already been done in terms of preparing artwork and making detailed notes.

Contributors are being asked to support and take a bit of a journey into the past for themselves. At the same time they are contributing to a resource, which offers a series of stepping stones towards widening access to Scottish culture, protecting cultural diversity and building authentic accounts.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding goes towards taking the current pool of raw materials, expanding it further and turning the whole lot into as polished a presentation as possible. Having prepared e-books before I'm aware how much can be done to deliver good quality content under your own steam - and how much more can be achieved with greater flexibility in terms of time, materials and kit.

The titles arrive as PDFs with standard US Letter pages, UK English and full page, colour illustrations. The text is 18-20 pt. This makes the files readable on many devices and keeps the text in shorter titles readable when set alongside the images for use as a presentation. Rewards are cumulative.

Please note the images are made at much larger size than IndieGoGo displays - to see all the layer effects and textures I recommend viewing on a colour monitor at 24" or a projector.

The + signs added to the perks below indicate the minimum content. For example, cover and title pages don't count.

Caledonia

  • - Scottish Legends (100+ pages, 12+ illustrations)

Scottish Legends includes selected tales from collections of original Scottish, Gaelic and Norse-Gael mythology. These are shown with colour illustrations of supernatural creatures and mythical treasures from Scotland's folklore. The e-book also has a short commentary on the myths and legends.
  • Alba (50+ pages, 25+ illustrations)

This title combines short comments on events from Scotland's early history with matching images. The content identifies many key events from the earliest prehistory through to the Middle Ages. Taken together the images and comments deliver a colourful 'route map' connecting up major or dramatic events or incidents. (There's a lot of artwork, but Alba necessarily collects from across the titles).

  • Primeval Scotland (36+ pages, 12+ illustrations)

Fuller commentary and images start to flesh out the story of early Scotland. Climate change, a huge meteor strike and any amount of volcanic activity feature large. While the inhabitants at various stages include sea scorpions, Skye's Jurassic dinosaurs and - those top-of-the line ambush predators - Sabretooth Tigers.

  • Ancient Scotland (36+ pages, 12+ illustrations)

Ancient Scotland continues from and follows the same approach as Primeval Scotland. As our distant ancestors arrive from Europe they begin by forming societies adapted to survive. However, as permanent hearths and homes appeared a sophisticated Neolithic civilisation developed - from roughly 6500 years ago.

Much of what these early 'Scots' made and exported is quite familiar, at least in name, from sites such as Orkney's Ness of Brodgar and, later, Callanish.

  • The Road to Bannockburn (60+ pages, 10+ illustrations)

The first of two colour illustrated titles on the First Scottish War of Independence goes into greater detail than the shorter titles above. Sections of the text were tried-out online as a testing ground for accessible content, resulting in adding revised text, new text and original documents to offer a broad account of the conflict.

The rebellion of De Moray and Wallace is covered in the first title; along with the years between Wallace's capture and the defining battle at Bannockburn.

  • The Defence of the Realm (60+ pages, 10+ illustrations)

The years after Bannockburn brought further conflict and this title looks at how the conflict was contained and what was done to consolidate Scotland's position. As with the first of the pair, the e-book includes colour illustrations, links to Wikipedia to map key locations and suggestions for further reading.

I'll add a slice of sample text from Defence of the Realm here:

"Douglas was about to celebrate the completion of a new hunting lodge at Lintalee in Jedburgh forest. Arundel thought it would be a good idea to send a force of several thousand axe-wielding men-at-arms to dismantle the new hunting lodge.

At the time James Douglas had barely fifty mounted men at his disposal, along with several companies of archers drawn from the nearby Douglas lands. An ambush was clearly in order and as Arundel's force approached Douglas ordered his men to lash together the trees and thickets on either side of a narrow point on the road.

The army of woodcutters advanced into the ambush, which Douglas triggered by leading his knights on a charge at the English vanguard. There may have been relatively few mounted Scottish knights, but funnelling them into a road and charging at full speed resulted in a pile driving effect.

The English vanguard couldn’t back up or escape to either side and the Scottish knights’ momentum placed a formidable bottleneck in the only available road. As a result, Douglas' archers simply set about pouring arrows into the largely immobilised English column.

Meanwhile, three hundred of the English troops had taken a different route and stumbled upon Douglas' generously provisioned but unoccupied lodge. Believing themselves safe in the knowledge that Douglas would either be defeated or at the very least delayed at length, the English soldiers settled down to enjoy a meal.

It wasn't a meal they had time to savour, as Douglas had identified Sir Thomas Richmond as the commander of the English forces on the ground during the Scots’ initial charge.

As the two forces clashed, Douglas leapt straight from his own horse on to Sir Thomas with a dagger at the ready.

Having stabbed the unfortunate Sir Thomas to death with the dagger, Douglas then claimed the English knight's fur hat as a trophy - which probably helped to further demoralise the already struggling English force.

Consequently, the battle was over almost as soon as it had started and Douglas went straight back to his lodge. Few, if any, of the band of feasting English soldiers survived his return."

The feedback on the trial text was consistently good. which comes across as an encouragement to add key features and characters skipped at the first attempt. In particular, the one text revised to two texts uses more intense images, adds quotes from original documents, covers the early rebellion more fully and includes more personal stories. Sample feedback at the time.

  • Caledonia (60+ pages, 10+ illustrations)

While sticking to the illustrated, accessible approach the project's most discursive title ranges across a series of controversial or much debated topics. These date from early to relatively modern times and reconsider people and events such as the enigmatic Beaker People, the war against the Romans and much more recently the Massacre of Glencoe. You can quickly review the evidence and make up your own mind about which scenarios seem most credible.

  • The Complete Caledonia (The Lot)

You're clearly a history enthusiast and you'd like all the content rolled into one epic e-title. That's a one of a kind copy with a cover chosen from the available artwork. Plus a title page showing your name and a Scottish symbol/ icon of choice from a set. Only you will receive the personal copy and hold access to your copy thereafter. I'll be making a handful of uniques for myself and immediate family, but will not be releasing your personal version.

Risks & Challenges

What happens if the project doesn't meet its goal. On returning to Scottish history after a long break I was pleasantly surprised by how much more archeologists have uncovered and been made aware of how misinformation thrives on the Internet. The work needs done from my point of view and that's why I've selected the flexible funding option.

So, if resources are short I'll just have to dig a bit deeper and curb my habit of adding an extra this and that along the way. Basically, if you support the project I deliver the agreed content I'm committed to delivering to a high standard.

The work involved is all known territory. I've 20+ years of concurrent experience in Secondary/ Higher Education and as a Fellow of the Higher Education Academy I'm trained to get the job done.

A solo project - apart from help with editing and proofing - relies on my availability. That is in place and other than unavoidable, exceptional circumstances I'll be sticking to agreed targets. I'm building a fair amount of leeway into the delivery date to begin with, but I fully intend to be sending out the first titles very soon after the 60 days of this crowdfund.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to chip in on the cash front I'd appreciate a share or a mention to your mates. Nothing like a bit of passing round to generate a little extra interest.
story_txt:
Short Summary Most of us are familiar with a few snapshots from Scottish history. Characters like Mary Queen of Scots and William Wallace crop up time and again alongside key events such as the Glencoe Massacre or Culloden. However, the broad brush of Scotland's history gets a lot less exposure and many remarkable events and fascinating lifestyles go largely unexplored.This project aims to make it straightforward and enjoyable to get a grasp on how the overall story fits together and explores highlights just waiting to be dragged out into the open. The content sets out to make more of Scotland's story highly accessible by presenting the past through lashings of colour artwork; very readable, relatively short accounts; and focusing on events which brought change. As a Scottish historian, experienced content developer and contract university lecturer, I'm trained for the work involved and a sizeable share of the heavy lifting has already been done in terms of preparing artwork and making detailed notes.
Contributors are being asked to support and take a bit of a journey into the past for themselves. At the same time they are contributing to a resource, which offers a series of stepping stones towards widening access to Scottish culture, protecting cultural diversity and building authentic accounts.
  What We Need & What You Get
 Funding goes towards taking the current pool of raw materials, expanding it further and turning the whole lot into as polished a presentation as possible. Having prepared e-books before I'm aware how much can be done to deliver good quality content under your own steam - and how much more can be achieved with greater flexibility in terms of time, materials and kit.
The titles arrive as PDFs with standard US Letter pages, UK English and
full page, colour illustrations. The text is 18-20 pt. This makes the files readable on many devices and keeps the text in shorter titles readable when set alongside the images for use as a presentation. Rewards are cumulative.
Please note the images are made at much larger size than IndieGoGo displays - to see all the layer effects and textures I recommend viewing on a colour monitor at 24" or a projector.
The + signs added to the perks below indicate the minimum content. For example, cover and title pages don't count. 

Caledonia

- Scottish Legends (100+ pages, 12+ illustrations)


Scottish Legends includes selected tales from collections of original Scottish, Gaelic and Norse-Gael mythology. These are shown with colour illustrations of supernatural creatures and mythical treasures from Scotland's folklore. The e-book also has a short commentary on the myths and legends.
Alba (50+ pages, 25+ illustrations)

This title combines short comments on events from Scotland's early history with matching images. The content identifies many key events from the earliest prehistory through to the Middle Ages. Taken together the images and comments deliver a colourful 'route map' connecting up major or dramatic events or incidents. (There's a lot of artwork, but Alba necessarily collects from across the titles).Primeval Scotland (36+ pages, 12+ illustrations)
Fuller commentary and images start to flesh out the story of early Scotland. Climate change, a huge meteor strike and any amount of volcanic activity feature large. While the inhabitants at various stages include sea scorpions, Skye's Jurassic dinosaurs and - those top-of-the line ambush predators - Sabretooth Tigers.


Ancient Scotland (36+ pages, 12+ illustrations)



Ancient Scotland continues from and follows the same approach as Primeval Scotland. As our distant ancestors arrive from Europe they begin by forming societies adapted to survive. However, as permanent hearths and homes appeared a sophisticated Neolithic civilisation developed - from roughly 6500 years ago. 
Much of what these early 'Scots' made and exported is quite familiar, at least in name, from sites such as Orkney's Ness of Brodgar and, later, Callanish.
The Road to Bannockburn (60+ pages, 10+ illustrations)


The first of two colour illustrated titles on the First Scottish War of Independence goes into greater detail than the shorter titles above. Sections of the text were tried-out online as a testing ground for accessible content, resulting in adding revised text, new text and original documents to offer a broad account of the conflict.
The rebellion of De Moray and Wallace is covered in the first title; along with the years between Wallace's capture and the defining battle at Bannockburn.
The Defence of the Realm (60+ pages, 10+ illustrations)

The years after Bannockburn brought further conflict and this title looks at how the conflict was contained and what was done to consolidate Scotland's position. As with the first of the pair, the e-book includes colour illustrations, links to Wikipedia to map key locations and suggestions for further reading.I'll add a slice of sample text from Defence of the Realm here:"Douglas was about to celebrate the completion of a new
hunting lodge at Lintalee in Jedburgh
forest.

a good idea to send a force of several thousand axe-wielding men-at-arms to

story:
Who am I?

My name is Dennis Thompson Jr., a Penn State grad with a bachelor’s in Life Science and a minor in Psychology. While I love science and learning about the secrets of our world and universe, my real passion in life, the thing that gets me out of bed in the morning is writing!

My Story:

I began the first draft of my first novel, Angels of War (a New Adult Techno-thriller centered on American college kids during societal collapse and war), in the summer of 2009 during my junior year of college and completed it before summer’s end. After it was over, I felt empty. I developed a constant yearning to write more, to build on the world that I created. So the following fall semester, I planned out the sequel. By Christmas I finished it. That following spring, I wrote and completed the third book of the series. Back then, it was just for fun. Sure, I edited it, and tweaked the story here and there, but I never intended to publish. It wasn’t until I graduated and started working a chemistry job I hated that I realized what I really wanted to do with my life. I wanted to be an author.

After a year, I lost my job. Finally armed with free time, I put the job hunt on pause and began taking the steps to get published––converting my story to manuscript format, writing query letters, etc. It took nearly a year of living off my savings to complete two painstaking rewrites and several rounds of editing to get Angels of War to its final draft. While I queried it, I combined my love of zombies, and my microbiology and neurobiology knowledge to start a completely new book series called Undying (a New Adult zombie novel).

A few months ago, while querying both novels, I got in contact with a literary agent who represented one of my favorite zombie series, The Remaining. He informed me that, due to oversaturation of the apocalyptic genre (specifically the zombie genre), major publishing presses weren’t picking up anything in that category unless it did well as a self-published book on Amazon first (which is how the author of The Remaining landed his deal). As someone adamant about controlling my own life, I am even more resolved to keep creative control over my stories in my hands––something you lose with traditional publishing. Also, the idea of higher royalties sounded enticing. Taking his advice, I began learning what it’d take to self-publish. So here I am, crowdfunding the one thing in life that I am truly passionate about.


What the Funds Will Be Used For:


For the self-published author, the only way to compete with our traditionally published counterparts is to give your book the same treatment theirs receive, and that's pricey! If things weren't difficult enough, here I am pushing the limits and self-publishing two books at once...

Your contributions will cover:

Editing: $1,000-$4,000 per book
Copy Editing, proofreading, possibly Developmental Editing (story/character progression), and a final edit. I am aiming for $4,000 for both novels.

Cover Art & Interior Design/Formatting: ~$1200 or less
We all judge books by their covers, and my homemade covers aren't the best. For something professionally done, the costs can range from $125-$700/novel (I’m looking more toward ~$400 per). Interior Design is around $200/novel.

ISBNs: $295
Every book needs an ISBN. One costs $125, but it’s more efficient to buy a block of ten for $295 to cover future sequels.

IndieGoGo’s 5% Cut: $600

Perks: ~$1,155-$1,500
Ordering copies of the books, T-shirts, bookmarks, posters, mugs, and mailing them all out to contributors will drain whatever is left. Funds from marketing may be reallocated to this.

Marketing: ~ $2,750-$4,750
Without aggressive marketing, a debut author like myself won’t sell anything more than 250 copies. Printing book copies and shipping them to bloggers and book review sites [Kirkus charges $425] will run about $825/book. $600 will be set aside for printing copies of both books for giveaways/early customer reviews. Anything I save from the other costs will go directly to marketing. Hopefully $2,000 will be leftover for one, solid, live-action book trailer for Angels of War !

What You Get in Return:


Your Mark on My Life. My Mark on the World.

Of all the things on my bucket list, making a career out of writing is at the very top. And with your contributions, I will be one step closer to achieving that goal. But this campaign is not all about me. With my writing, I hope to not only entertain readers, but to enlighten them as well. Through Angels of War, I hope to help teach readers to question the society we live in, to expose them to elements of the world many are not aware of, and to spread the message that even just one man or woman has the power to change the world. Through Zora Undying, I hope to not only privy readers to the darker side of humanity, but also teach survival skills for a world without rule of law and the importance of preparing for the worse.

Risks & Challenges:

The goal is to have both books published with Amazon's CreateSpace, the number one Self-Publishing company in the world. With print on demand services making it more affordable to self-publish, and with major presses churning out books like newspapers, all publishing ventures have inherent risk due to oversaturation. In the U.S. alone, there are somewhere between 600,000 and 1,000,000 books published every year. Every author battles writers of similar genres for space on bookshelves. For indie and self-published authors, we come into this war disadvantage due to the lack of financial resources to market the way the Big 5 Publishers can. To overcome this, I plan on launching an aggressive marketing campaign that involves hiring YouTube film channels to shoot a live action trailer for my books and enlisting the services of major book bloggers, review sites, and possibly a marketing specialist to help promote my novels.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Times are hard (believe me, I know), so if you are unable to contribute to my campaign, please help me out by sharing this with your friends and family. And if you have any influential connections, please send them my way. The more exposure this campaign receives, the better my odds are for reaching my goal and making my dream a reality. Also, if you're reading this, like my author fan page on Facebook and follow my Twitter account for exclusive updates on the books and to find out when they are hitting Amazon & shelves!

story:
We value your assistance - a big shoutout to all readers who supported Phases I & II! We've experienced many personal challenges and setbacks during the early campaign phases, but we're back on track and ready to roll again. Phase III will end as our cover art is revealed in July!

The Contest and Other Stories is a Young Adult / New Adult collection of nineteen spellbinding magical realism, paranormal, dark fantasy, slipstream, alternate history, and fabulist tales inspired by the works of international artists, and connected by a novella set in mid-twentieth-century New York City. Five stories are previously published in anthologies and journals. The lead story, “Night Café,” won the quarterly New Short Fiction Award at Jerry Jazz Musician (2012).

THE STORY BEHIND THE STORIES

Written by authors Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson (and edited by Starstone Lit), this connected collection of Young Adult and New Adult speculative fiction inspired by artwork will be released in Summer 2017 by Tootie-Do Press. The publication requires extra funding due to  professional production costs for color inserts of well-known (and some not so well-known) paintings by international artists that inspired each story, and expenses related to the enhanced color ebook publication. The volume will be available in full-color hardcover, full-color softcover, BW interior softcover, and in color and BW e-book formats.

THE CONNECTING NOVELLA / BOOK PITCH

Peter John Rizzo,  a 1960 graduate of Yale University’s journalism program and an emerging creative writer, inherits Classic Art Exposé, an established but floundering art journal, from his uncle, John Rizzo.

Peter Rizzo, Pete’s father, is a banker who despises his late brother, scornful of his career in the Arts and Humanities, and jealous of his sibling’s influential relationship with his wife and son.

Jason, Uncle John’s devoted but unorthodox editorial assistant, and two local English student interns, sisters Shirley and Evie, help Pete start a monthly short story contest with artwork prompts, hoping to increase Classic Art Exposé’s readership and settle its debt.

As the four friends publish the winning short stories in the monthly journal over the following eighteen months, Pete must battle his father’s attempts to ruin his business and his reputation, and in the process, he discovers a sordid family secret.

THE STORIES & THE ARTWORK

"Night Café" - Le Café de Nuit - Vincent van Gogh, 1888

"Vasily" - The Bachelor Guitarist - Vasily Gregorivich Perov, 1865

"Hero" - The Accolade - Sir Edmund Blair Leighton, 1901

"Praise Neptune" - The Abduction of the Sabine Women - Nicolas Poussin, 1635

"The Conquistadors’ Surprise" - Emperor Charles V at Muhlberg - Titian, 1548

"Lost Memories" - The Gallery of H.M.S. Calcutta-Portsmouth - James Jacques Joseph Tissot, 1877

"The Snow Globe" - The Horse-Race - Jean-Louis Forain, 1890

"A Life in Flowers" - Le Chevalier aux Fleurs - Georges-Antoine Rochegrosse, 1894

"A Twisted Garden" - Jardin des Peupliers - Vincent van Gogh, 1889

"The Island" - New York Harbor - Alfred Thompson Bricher, 1877

"Nicor" - Morning by the Stream - T.C. Steele, 1893

"Masterpiece" - The Knife Grinder (Principle of Scintillation) - Kasimir Malevich, 1912

"Looking Out for Harry"-Avenue de Clichy: Five o’Clock - Louis Anquetin, 1887

"The Imposter" - Napoleon On Board the Bellerophon - Sir Wlm. Q. Orchardson, 1880

"Alone" - Snow at Louevciennes - Alfred Sisley, 1878

"Cheater" - The Cowboy - Frederick Remington, 1902

"Success" - Dance at Bougival - Pierre-Auguste Renoir, 1882

"The Jonah" - Y une place Animee a Paris - Joaquin Pallares Y Allustante, 1898

"Heaven or Hell?" - Dante & Virgil in Hell - William-Adolphe Bougereau, 1850

::~Acknowledgments~:: 

“Cheater” first appeared in Western Weird, Volume 4, Manifest West Series, (Western Press Books - Western State Colorado University, 2015).

“Night Café” won the quarterly New Short Fiction Award (Jerry Jazz Musician, 2012).

“Lost Memories” first appeared in The Memory Eater (CP Anthologies, 2012).

“A Twisted Garden” first appeared as “The Yellow House” in Say Goodnight to the Bad Guy (May December Publications, 2011).

“The Snow Globe” first appeared in Best Served Cold: An Eye for An Eye (Runewright LLC, 2011).

REVIEWS

"'Yellow House' - featured in Say Goodnight to the Bad Guy [now titled 'A Twisted Garden' ] - by Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson - Historical horror with a new spin on a complex artist. I was intrigued the way the writers tied the painting to the story." 

~ Chantal Boudreau, (Author, Nova Scotia), 2011

~*~

"I love the atmosphere and narration in the story Night Café... vivid and gripping... The frame narrative [The Contest] is a lot more compelling than I had initially expected. Not only does it have slight hints of beat literature to it (eg: reefer, sleeping in offices, etc.), but the story idea about an art magazine is a really interesting one too."

~ UK millennial reader, 2017

AUTHOR BIOS

On a dull, cold day in February 2011,  authors Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson decided to have fun with some story collaborations. Joe sports the vivid imagination and Kate wields the detail toolbox and the word-whacking polish.

Separately, they've authored a variety of adult, young adult, middle-grade, and children’s fiction, nonfiction, and poetry in online and print journals and anthologies, including publications with Kearney Street Press, Southport Press, Rainstorm Press, Blood Bound Books, Elastic Press, Jerry Jazz Musician, Kaleidoscope, Literary Mama, Long Story Short, Raven Chronicles, The Whirlwind Review, June Cotner anthologies, Western Press Books, and others.

Joe DiBuduo is a retired housepainter with a wild bucket list. He also fills his front yard with giant sculptures, and earned a certificate in creative writing from Yavapai College in Prescott, Arizona (2009). Bookwise, he's the author of two mixed genre paranormal novels, The Mountain Will Cover You  & Cryonic Man: A Paranormal Affair (JD Books, 2016 and Tootie-Do Press, 2015); a connected collection of short stories: Story Time @ The Chicagoua Cafe (JD Books 2016), a historically relevant memoir, Death by Electric Chair & Other Boyhood Pursuits (Jaded Ibis Productions, 2015), a popular nonfiction narrative, A Penis Manologue: One Man's Response to The Vagina Monologues (JD Books, 2009, 2013), Out of This World Sci-fi Poetry (JD Books, 2010), two children's e-books, and miscellaneous collections of quirky flash fiction and “flash fiction poetry.”

Kate earned an MA in Creative Writing from Aberystwyth University, Wales (2010) and is the wordwhacking specialist at Starstone Lit Services and Tootie-Do Press near Los Angeles. Bookwise, she’s the author of a metaphysical sci-fi novel, Heart of Desire: 11.11.11 Redux (Tootie-Do Press, 2014), and two history books for middle-graders, The National Mall and Lewis and Clark: Exploring the American West (Enslow, Inc., 2005 and 2010). Loop, her MA program fantasy novella created from dreams shortlisted in the Texas Review Press Novella competition in 2010, and was recently revised and updated while she enjoyed the lake district at the Arteles Creative Center during the November 2016 Silence Awareness Existence residency in Finland. Her work in progress includes a memoir, a collection of nature essays, a poetry collection, retold folktales, and picture book fiction. She's also dreaming up quirky sequels to her metaphysical sci-fi novel and dream novella, which she would love to write in a galaxy far away, but will settle for the sweet redwood glade she recently moved to.

THE PRESS

Tootie-Do Press publishes intelligent speculative fiction with a romantic twist. The Contest and Other Stories is the third press publication and first Young Adult / New Adult title!  Previous Tootie-Do Press publications are Heart of Desire: 11.11.11 Redux, a metaphysical sci-fi novel by Kate Robinson, and Cryonic Man: A Paranormal Affair, a mixed genre paranormal romance by Joe DiBuduo.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Have a minute and a few clicks to spare? We'd be grateful for any social media support for our fundraising campaign. Please tweet, blog, and share links to our campaign for The Contest and Other Stories. Share with #TheContest, #TootieDoPress, #YA #NA (or any other appropriate hashtag) at Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Tumblr, Google+, Instagram (or any social media platform serving authors and readers). Add The Contest to as a to-read on Goodreads after final publication! You can also use the buttons here on Indiegogo to share this fundraiser with your friends and contacts.

When the book cover is complete in late July 2017 (the wonderful Clarissa Yeo at Yocla Designs is our cover artist), Indiegogo backers will get the first reveal!

Those of you who have already pre-ordered the full-color early release PDF from our first stage and second fundraiser may share copies of it with family and friends. Please direct any YA / NA readers you know to our fundraiser - some who read the The Contest & Other Stories PDF may also want to order print or e-book versions!

Tootie-Do Press can be reached for orders or concerns via email at starstonelit@gmail.com.
story_txt:
We value your assistance - a big shoutout to all readers who supported Phases I & II! We've experienced many personal challenges and setbacks during the early campaign phases, but we're back on track and ready to roll again. Phase III will end as our cover art is revealed in July!
The Contest and Other Stories is a Young Adult / New Adult collection of nineteen spellbinding magical realism, paranormal, dark fantasy, slipstream, alternate history, and fabulist tales inspired by the works of international artists, and connected by a novella set in mid-twentieth-century New York City. Five stories are previously published in anthologies and journals. The lead story, “Night Café,” won the quarterly New Short Fiction Award at Jerry Jazz Musician (2012).
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORIES
Written by authors Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson (and edited by Starstone Lit), this connected collection of Young Adult and New Adult speculative fiction inspired by artwork will be released in Summer 2017 by Tootie-Do Press. The publication requires extra funding due to  professional production costs for color inserts of well-known (and some not so well-known) paintings by international artists that inspired each story, and expenses related to the enhanced color ebook publication. The volume will be available in full-color hardcover, full-color softcover, BW interior softcover, and in color and BW e-book formats.
THE CONNECTING NOVELLA / BOOK PITCH
Peter John Rizzo,  a 1960 graduate of Yale University’s journalism program and an emerging creative writer, inherits Classic Art Exposé, an established but floundering art journal, from his uncle, John Rizzo.
Peter Rizzo, Pete’s father, is a banker who despises his late brother, scornful of his career in the Arts and Humanities, and jealous of his sibling’s influential relationship with his wife and son.
Jason, Uncle John’s devoted but unorthodox editorial assistant, and two local English student interns, sisters Shirley and Evie, help Pete start a monthly short story contest with artwork prompts, hoping to increase Classic Art Exposé’s readership and settle its debt.
As the four friends publish the winning short stories in the monthly journal over the following eighteen months, Pete must battle his father’s attempts to ruin his business and his reputation, and in the process, he discovers a sordid family secret.
THE STORIES & THE ARTWORK
"Night Café" - Le Café de Nuit - Vincent van Gogh, 1888
"Vasily" - The Bachelor Guitarist - Vasily Gregorivich Perov, 1865
"Hero" - The Accolade - Sir Edmund Blair Leighton, 1901
"Praise Neptune" - The Abduction of the Sabine Women - Nicolas Poussin, 1635
"The Conquistadors’ Surprise" - Emperor Charles V at Muhlberg - Titian, 1548
"Lost Memories" - The Gallery of H.M.S. Calcutta-Portsmouth - James Jacques Joseph Tissot, 1877
"The Snow Globe" - The Horse-Race - Jean-Louis Forain, 1890
"A Life in Flowers" - Le Chevalier aux Fleurs - Georges-Antoine Rochegrosse, 1894
"A Twisted Garden" - Jardin des Peupliers - Vincent van Gogh, 1889
"The Island" - New York Harbor - Alfred Thompson Bricher, 1877
"Nicor" - Morning by the Stream - T.C. Steele, 1893
"Masterpiece" - The Knife Grinder (Principle of Scintillation) - Kasimir Malevich, 1912
"Looking Out for Harry"-Avenue de Clichy: Five o’Clock - Louis Anquetin, 1887
"The Imposter" - Napoleon On Board the Bellerophon - Sir Wlm. Q. Orchardson, 1880
"Alone" - Snow at Louevciennes - Alfred Sisley, 1878
"Cheater" - The Cowboy - Frederick Remington, 1902
"Success" - Dance at Bougival - Pierre-Auguste Renoir, 1882
"The Jonah" - Y une place Animee a Paris - Joaquin Pallares Y Allustante, 1898
"Heaven or Hell?" - Dante & Virgil in Hell - William-Adolphe Bougereau, 1850
::~Acknowledgments~:: 
“Cheater” first appeared in Western Weird, Volume 4, Manifest West Series, (Western Press Books - Western State Colorado University, 2015).
“Night Café” won the quarterly New Short Fiction Award (Jerry Jazz Musician, 2012).
“Lost Memories” first appeared in The Memory Eater (CP Anthologies, 2012).
“A Twisted Garden” first appeared as “The Yellow House” in Say Goodnight to the Bad Guy (May December Publications, 2011).
“The Snow Globe” first appeared in Best Served Cold: An Eye for An Eye (Runewright LLC, 2011).
REVIEWS
"'Yellow House' - featured in Say Goodnight to the Bad Guy [now titled 'A Twisted Garden' ] - by Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson - Historical horror with a new spin on a complex artist. I was intrigued the way the writers tied the painting to the story." 
~ Chantal Boudreau, (Author, Nova Scotia), 2011
~*~
"I love the atmosphere and narration in the story Night Café... vivid and gripping... The frame narrative [The Contest] is a lot more compelling than I had initially expected. Not only does it have slight hints of beat literature to it (eg: reefer, sleeping in offices, etc.), but the story idea about an art magazine is a really interesting one too."
~ UK millennial reader, 2017
AUTHOR BIOS
On a dull, cold day in February 2011,  authors Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson decided to have fun with some story collaborations. Joe sports the vivid imagination and Kate wields the detail toolbox and the word-whacking polish.
Separately, they've authored a variety of adult, young adult, middle-grade, and children’s fiction, nonfiction, and poetry in online and print journals and anthologies, including publications with Kearney Street Press, Southport Press, Rainstorm Press, Blood Bound Books, Elastic Press, Jerry Jazz Musician, Kaleidoscope, Literary Mama, Long Story Short, Raven Chronicles, The Whirlwind Review, June Cotner anthologies, Western Press Books, and others.
Joe DiBuduo is a retired housepainter with a wild bucket list. He also fills his front yard with giant sculptures, and earned a certificate in creative writing from Yavapai College in Prescott, Arizona (2009). Bookwise, he's the author of two mixed genre paranormal novels, The Mountain Will Cover You  & Cryonic Man: A Paranormal Affair (JD Books, 2016 and Tootie-Do Press, 2015); a connected collection of short stories: Story Time @ The Chicagoua Cafe (JD Books 2016), a historically relevant memoir, Death by Electric Chair & Other Boyhood Pursuits (Jaded Ibis Productions, 2015), a popular nonfiction narrative, A Penis Manologue: One Man's Response to The Vagina Monologues (JD Books, 2009, 2013), Out of This World Sci-fi Poetry (JD Books, 2010), two children's e-books, and miscellaneous collections of quirky flash fiction and “flash fiction poetry.”
Kate earned an MA in Creative Writing from Aberystwyth University, Wales (2010) and is the wordwhacking specialist at Starstone Lit Services and Tootie-Do Press near Los Angeles. Bookwise, she’s the author of a metaphysical sci-fi novel, Heart of Desire: 11.11.11 Redux (Tootie-Do Press, 2014), and two history books for middle-graders, The National Mall and Lewis and Clark: Exploring the American West (Enslow, Inc., 2005 and 2010). Loop, her MA program fantasy novella created from dreams shortlisted in the Texas Review Press Novella competition in 2010, and was recently revised and updated while she enjoyed the lake district at the Arteles Creative Center during the November 2016 Silence Awareness Existence residency in Finland. Her work in progress includes a memoir, a collection of nature essays, a poetry collection, retold folktales, and picture book fiction. She's also dreaming up quirky sequels to her metaphysical sci-fi novel and dream novella, which she would love to write in a galaxy far away, but will settle for the sweet redwood glade she recently moved to.

story:
Bref résumé

 Raphael a une une vie bien remplie

  • Afin de laisser une trace de son témoignage et pour que nous ayons une mémoire ,  partie de notre patrimoine familial , voici le cadeau que nous pourrions lui offrir :
  • Le livre de sa vie

 

 Au delà de la participation financière de tous que nous recherchons , les informations , souvenirs  que vous avez sont une richesse et un trésor que nous recherchons

  •  Des souvenirs le concernant , des photos , des éléments que vous avez  et qui pourront enrichir les souvenirs de Raphael
  •  Vous participez ainsi à l'aventure selon vos possibilités
  •  Nous visons de pouvoir contacter un écrivain public dont l'activité est de mettre en forme les souvenirs des personnes qu'il rencontrera

 L'impact

Un cadeau pour Raphael de nous tous et en retour une histoire que nous pourrons faire lire à nos proches

  •  Le projet est précieux car combien d'entre nous regrette de ne pas l'avoir fait pour des amis, des proches,  par manque de temps , parce que nous n'y avons pas pensé ...etc...
  • L'opportunité est ici offerte à chacun d'enrichir l'histoire
  • L'appel a un professionnel dont c'est le travail est un gage de réussite pour ce projet
  •  Un livre sortira de cette aventure ... Le livre de Raphael.
  • Si nous parvenons au financement.

 Risques et défis

 Nous sommes à votre disposition pour échanger avec vous et vous tenir au courant.

  •  Rien ne se fera sans vous.
  •  Le temps tourne et l'age de Raphael avance. Il faut avoir en tête cet élément  car le livre est à lui faire en cadeau au plus tôt et n'est pas imaginé à ce jour comme une œuvre posthume!

  Raphael n'est pas au courant de ce projet et ce sera une surprise si nous arrivons au financement 

  •  Si vous avez des moyens de nous aider dans ce sens, merci d'avance (passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de ce  projet)

Pour en découvrir un peu plus sur Raphaël MASSON  , voilà quelques liens disponibles sur la page  http://tom-brian-garcia.tk/raphael-masson/

[Lien] Quelques souvenirs d'un ancien des Groupes Lourds - par Raphaël MASSON

[Img] "Informations en plus du CV" - Raphaël MASSON

[Lien] Souvenir d'une de mes 36 missions ("Nuit des Intruders") - par Raphaël MASSON

[Lien] Mission sur Kamen ("Pour mon ami Raphaël MASSON") - par Paul GRIDELET

[Lien] Bibliographies sur les Groupes Lourds

story:
Mi az A Tarka?

A Tarka egy mondókás könyv. 16 db rövid mondóka, hanghalmozó, nyelvtörő van benne. 

A fiamnak írtam őket. Amikor az első hangokat gyakorolta, amikor szótagokkal, szavakkal kezdett játszani, tovább zsonglőrködtem velük. Így születtek a hanghalmozók, nyelvtörők. 

A hintázás közben szerettem volna a Dunába ugró katona helyett valami sajátot mondani neki. Így született a rakétás hintázós.

A katicát pedig megsajnáltam, mert a törökök rettentően megkínozzák, teljesen céltalanul. Így lett ebből a tudósok által vizsgált medveállatka.

Mindegyik mondókának története van. Vannak köztük egyszerűbbek, vannak kedvesek, és vannak nehezen értelmezhetőek.

Köszönöm a dzsemmelést Tumbász Viktornak és Szabó Tamás Tavkennek!

 

A tartalom meglehetősen tarka.

Ezért is kértem meg Tóvaj Rozáliát, hogy a könyvben a mondókák mellett megjelenő 16 db rajz is változatos legyen. El is készültek: különböző stílusban, különbüző technikákkal. Ennek köszönhetően A Tarka nem illeszthető be a hagyományos, könyvesboltban árult könyvek sorába. Nem a népszerűségre törekszik, nem a közízlés kiszolgálása a célja.

Ez a könyv egy különlegesség. 

"Ez a könyv olyan, mint mi emberek: egyszer absztrakt, egyszer csak prüntyögős. Jól egyensúlyoz a gyerek-felnőtt világ között. A család minden tagja találhat benne neki tetsző mondókát. Vicces, játékos, és van benne szó a pukiról! A gyerekek imádják az ilyesmit! 

A mondókák nem feltétlenül egy korosztálynak valók. De nem baj, hogy vannak nehéz szavak. Pont ez az érdekes a nyelvben: minden szó absztrakció. Amikor egy kisgyerek ráérez a beszéd ízére, sokszor azért ismételget egy szót, mert tetszik neki a hangzása. Addig mondogatja, amíg már szinte függetlenedik a jelentéstől, és csak a ritmus, a dallam, a kimondás öröme marad. A könyv szómágiás hangulata megragadó, és fejleszti a szókincset, ritmusérzéket is. Egy kis skandálás után mindegyik mondóka ritmusára rá lehet érezni. Van, ami nyelvtörőnek is beillik.  

Érzem benne az apát, aki a gyerekével együtt fedezi fel újra a nyelv sokszínűségét. És persze az is lehet, hogy van benne olyan mondóka, ami csak apának fog tetszeni." 

(Stein Katalin, 5 éve anya)

A könyv célja, hogy bátorságot adjon az apáknak a saját szójátékaik, mondókáik megalkotásához.

Ez a könyv az Apa Könyvek első könyve.

 

Mi az az Apa Könyvek?

2018-ban lettem apa. Az elmúlt néhány évben, azt vettem észre, hogy az apák szeretnének jobban részt vállalni a gyermekük életében, de az igazság az, hogy nagyot változott a világ a mostani apák gyerekkora óta. A minták nagy része, amiket apáinktól kaptunk, már csak részben érvényesek, és vannak új helyzetek, amikre nem is kaphattunk mintát tőlük. Kissé magunkra hagyva keressük az utat, milyen az elég jó apa.

Sokkal többet is tudok erről írni. Ha érdekel, akkor tobvábbi részleteket az Apa Könyvekről a blogunkban olvashatsz: https://apakonyvek.hu/mi-az-az-apa-konyvek/

 

Mit kapsz a támogatásodért?

A támogatási összegtől függetlenül minden támogató kap egy példányt A Tarka című mondókás könyvből, ha a kampány összeg 50%át elérjük.

 

Miért kell ez a kampány?

Ennek a kampánynak az elsődleges célja, hogy A Tarka becsülettel megjelenhessen. Ehhez nagyjából 2 millió forintra van szükségünk. Másodlagos célként a következő könyvek előkészítését tűztem ki. Tehát a célként kitűzött 4 millió forint a következőkből áll össze:

  • A Tarka könyv grafikus tiszteletdíja (mert eddig ingyen dolgozott)
  • A Tarka könyv tördelő tiszteletdíja (mert eddig ingyen dolgozott)
  • E kampány marketingköltsége (mert valahogy hallanod kellett rólunk)
  • A Tarka könyv nyomdaköltsége (mert a könyv nem a fán terem)
  • A támogatásért küldött jutalmak postaköltsége (mert ezzel is számolnunk kell)
  • Tőkeképzés az Apa Könyvek további terveinek megvalósításához (mert rengeteg tervünk van)

Minden támogatást szívesen fogadunk, de bizonyos összegek felett jutalommal köszönjük meg az adományodat!

A jutalmom postázásához fel kell vennünk veled a kapcsolatot, ezért a támogatás megadásakor járulj hozzá, hogy neved és e-mail címem továbbítodjon a Kampány tulajdonosának. 

Hosszú távú célok...

Leírhatatlanul sok tervem és elképzelésem van. Nagyon sokféle könyvet szeretnék kiadni, amiben a természettudományos érdekességektől kezdve, a nevelési helyzetek bemutatása is jelen van. Érdemes a Facebook oldalunkat figyelni. Előkészületben van Pőc és a tengeri kaland című könyv, amiben az esti rutin keretében keveredik Pőc és apa egy tanulságos cápás kalandba.

Jobban megismernél minket?

Apa Könyvek Facebook oldal
Apa Könyvek Honlap

Gyakran ismételt kérdések

Miért 4 millió a cél? Rengetegnek tűnik.

Hozzávetőlegesen a számok: A grafikai munka, 32 oldal esetén, 500.000 forint.  A nyomdai előkészítés 100.000 forint. 1000 db könyv nyomdai előállítása 600.000 forint. Az 1000 db postai küldése 500.000 forint. Ahhoz, hogy legyenek támogatók, hirdetni kell, erre 200.000 forintot számoltam. Így járunk 1,9 milliónál járunk. Ha 2000 darabot szeretnénk, akkor a nyomdai költség egyharmaddal nő, a postai költség duplázódik. És ezzel a kampánnyal szeretném a következő könyveket is megalapozni...

 

Köszönöm, hogy végigolvastad.

Sablik Henrik, 3 éve apa
