     People who cannot contribute to the fundraiser can still help out by sharing the campaign on Facebook with their family members, friends, co-workers, and anyone else who might be interested in Coeburn history. You can do this by simply clicking on the Facebook icon at the top of the page.

About The Authors
     Dee Ratliff Kenady grew up in the forests of the Cumberland Plateau, living the rare life of a free mountain child. As an adult she has worked hard to share her journey in print, publishing many poems, stories, and books that are well-rooted in her Appalachian life experience. Dee's knowledge and insight about the "old ways" has been invaluable in framing this project in a meaningful context.
     Wade Kenady is originally from Caney Ridge, just inside Dickenson County. He began his education in the two-room Rugby School and later attended schools at Clintwood and Coeburn. As an amateur historian he has studied local stories and Appalachian culture for over a decade. Wade still has kinfolk living in the Coeburn area, and consider it to be his memorable hometown.
Thanks so much to you all for your tremendous encouragement and support!Wade & Dee

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Svetlana. I have been working as a teacher for 8 years. During this period of time I have collected many my own ideas about improving the method of foreign languages teaching for Ukrainian kids, how to make the process of studying interesting and efficient. Writing a children's study book is a long held dream of mine and it is so close to coming true! You are helping it become a reality.

Bonjour! Je m’appelle Svetlana. Je travaille en tant que professeur depuis 8 ans. Pendant cette période de temps, j'ai recueilli beaucoup de mes propres idées. Il s’agit de l'amélioration de la méthode de l'enseignement des langues étrangères pour les enfants ukrainiens ainsi que comment faire ce processus plus intéressant et efficace. La rédaction d'un livre d'étude pour les enfants est mon vieux rêve et il est sur le point de se réaliser! Et c’est vous qui l’aidez à devenir une réalité.

My book is about learning French as a second foreign language after English for Ukrainian kids. This topic is not well implemented here Ukraine. My message is to help children start studying French quickly and funny.

Mon livre est  destiné pour les enfants ukrainiens qui apprennent le français comme deuxième langue étrangère après l'anglais. Malheuresement, ce sujet n'est pas appliqué correctement ici en Ukraine. Mon but est d'aider les enfants à apprendre le français dans une manière drôle et rapide.

You may ask, why do have such a topic. While teaching both languages I mentioned the key problems that appear in the process of studying French: difficulties with reading, misunderstanding of grammar, which lead to the lack of motivation. I think it is very important to show children at the very beginning there are so many similar features they can find in French and English. Here in Ukraine children start studying French at the age of 10-11 years. At this moment, they are studying English for 4 years. For many of them it is very difficult do manage with two foreign languages. Another problem is that here in Ukraine not all the parents can help their children with studying, because very often they do not know French, when it is important to help them at home with their home works, to talk, to explain and even paly in foreign language games. Therefore, I have designed my study book in such a way, that it will be easy for children to understand grammar and vocabulary (all new items will be presented in comparison with Ukrainian and English). In addition, book will contain board games to play at home with friends and parents (there is another goal - to involve them also into studying).

Vous pouvez demander, pourquoi j’ai choisi ce sujet. Quand j'ai enseigné deux langues, j’ai toujours fait attention sur les questions clés qui se posent au cours de processus de l'apprentissage du français: les problèmes avec la lecture et la grammaire malentendue qui ont pour conséquence une manque de motivation.Je crois qu’au début de la formation il est important de montrer aux enfants que le français et l'anglais ont beaucoup en commun.​

In addition, I want to teach children to analyze the information they are working with.To make the boring rules funny, I have chosen superheroes as main characters of my study book. Colorful and bright pictures help to remember things better. You know that design of the book, its content is very important for children and this fact influences on their desire to study too. In addition, I know that children now prefer computer games to paper books, but parents should remember that child's memory does not work in the same way as adult person. Paper books help them to enlarge their long-term memory, because of the opportunity to reread new information, to have enough time to think over the question.

En Ukraine, les enfants commencent à apprendre le français à l'âge de 10-11 ans. A ce moment-là, ils apprennent l'anglais déjà pendant 4 ans. Pour beaucoup d'enfants de cet âge il est vraiment difficile à apprendre deux langues étrangères en même temps. Un autre problème est ce que beaucoup de parents ne peuvent pas aider leurs enfants à faire leurs devoirs ou expliquer des règles car ils ne parlent pas cette langue. Par conséquent, j’ai décidé de créer mon livre pour que les enfants puissent lire librement, comprendre la grammaire, apprendre de nouveaux mots. Tous les nouveaux aspects de la grammaire et du vocabulaire seront effectués en comparaison avec l’ukrainien et l’anglais. En plus, ce livre contiendra plusieurs jeux de sociétés pour que les enfants puissent jouer non seulement avec  autres enfants mais avec aussi leurs parents.Je tiens également à enseigner aux enfants à analyser l'information avec laquelle ils travaillent.Pour faire les règles ennuyeux plus gaies, j’ai decidé que les super-héros deviennent les personnages principaux de mon livre d’études. Des images vives et colorées aident à mémoriser des choses plus vite. Des illustrations du livre ainsi que son contenu sont aussi très importants pour les enfants car ils influencent directement sur leur envie d’apprendre la langue étrangère.

Je sais que les enfants aiment les jeux d'ordinateur plus que les livres, mais les parents doivent garder à l’esprit que la mémoire des enfants ne fonctionne pas de la même façon que celle des adultes. Des livres papiers aident les enfants à augmenter la mémoire de long terme, parce qu'ils donnent la possibilité de relire la nouvelle information.

What I Need & What You Get

The money I raise here will go directly to publishing cost, designer work.

Possible prizes are: digital wallpaper, PDF-version

Your contribute is very important, because you help to implement new ideas in the country, where they are especially important at the moment. Knowledge of foreign languages is very useful skill, which help people to understand each other better and make our world more comfortable and friendly.

De quoi j'ai besoin & ce que vous obtenez

L'argent amassé ici sera utilisé pour payer l'édition et le travail de designer.

Des prix possibles sont un fond d'écran numérique et une  PDF version du livre.

Votre contribution est très important, parce que vous aider à mettre en œuvre de nouvelles idées dans le pays où ils sont particulièrement importants pour le moment. La connaissance des langues étrangères est une compétence très utile, qui aide les gens à se comprendre mieux et de rendre notre monde plus confortable et convivial.

Je serai très reconnaissant, si vous utilisez outils de partage d’IndieGoGo.

Nous créons l'avenir ensemble!

 Ukrainian version of the video

Book trailer- short story

Earth 2117 - people  do not communicate with each other - they start to forget their languages - virtual reality took over the world - her friends help her - they supervise people day and night - but there are heroes on the planet - who fight with bad guys - masters of all foreign languages decided to help heroes - they created magic books and fill them up with secret knowledge - it is mighty and beauty of every language - they want to warn the humanity about the danger - masters give one of these books for secret mission - superheroes open the time gate and go to Ukraine to nowadays - but bad guys also manage to go after them - superheroes have mission under  secret code @French@ - they have to give Ukrainians knowledge with a book - for this they will use Ukrainian and English language - do all the tasks! - superheroes will help you to open the power of language - be a superhero!

story:
Revolution of the Monks

Realization

Author – Ashin (saffron revolution monk leader)

Country – Myanmar & France

Language – Burmese, English, French

Series – Culture

Genre – Novel

Publisher – In house (self-published author)

Publishing date – 2015

Media type – E-book, Print (Softback)

Purchase (direct) - Buy on Amazon.com

Pages – 204

Product Dimensions – 5.1 x 0.5 x 7.8 inches

Shipping Weight – 9.9 ounces

ISBN – 9782953747003


Crew

- Writer - Ashin, version Burmese.

- Premier version edited into English by Doctor Aung Min, screenwriter of film (THE MONK), and his wife,

- Book edits media design - Steve Henderson (Professional Photographer)

and Daniel Massidda (Graphic Designer)

-Site Designer - Mr. Bernard Banoviez (Informatician)

Main Characters


- U Yevata (Ashin Yevata, writer and main character of novel)

- Aurélie (French love interest)

- Mr. Lothar Kinzemmann (Mr.L) German friend of Ashin

- U Gambira (U Sandawbarsa, arrested after the revolution)

- Doctor Aung Min (AM ) Screenwriter for the film (THE MONK)

- Aung San Suu Kyi (1991 Nobel peace prize winner)

- U Agga (Chulalongkorn University in Thailand, a friend of Ashin)

- Zarganar (Famous Burmese comedian)

- Kyaw Thu (Famous Burmese actor)

- U Sandarsiri(a) Payit  (Monk from Maggin monastery, arrested after the saffron revolution)

What is the Revolution of the Monks ?

           This novel is based on the Saffron Revolution of the Burmese Monks which took place in Burma (Myanmar), September 2007. Ashin Yevata was one of the monk leaders in the protest just before the Tibetan unrest in 2008. Burma had been under military dictatorship for 60 years. These are his accounts during the Saffron revolution for the liberty of the Burmese people, and also his personal revolution.


The Story

            REVOLUTION OF THE MONKS is a personal journey of a Buddhist Monk through the protests in Myanmar (Burma) 2007. The book describes events of the protests against dictatorship, personal relationships and thoughts and feelings of a practicing monk.

As a Former Burmese Buddhist Monk, he decided to write about his role in the Revolution of the Monks and share an insight into his personal life during the Revolution of 2007, Political and Military participation in the protests, and their personal and cultural differences.

This book was written in Thailand 2008 while waiting to enter Europe, his goal was to record information on the Revolution so this piece of history was not lost.

It has been six years in the making with translations from Burmese to English, French, Spanish and German.


Why We Need Your Help

            The purpose of this book is to raise donations to realize his dream of running a free, gratis, Wellbeing Center. The doors will be open to all. Why do this? Ashin would like to make exchanges with students, free from constraints of money, this provides good morality and honest participations, this also ensures the less fortunate among us have the opportunity to attend the center. Another benefit will be a school already opened by Ashin in Burma, where young monks and local children learn to read and write and speak foreign languages, to aid in the advancement of themselves.

               This is a monastic school where Ashin taught English language to the candidates, monks and novices who don’t have parent at gratis monastic school.

 If you would like to meet the students in Yangon, you can join us on our visit or go to directly yourself to (Kaytumadi monastery, Mayangone Township Yangon, Myanmar)

Our slogan is “help others by helping ourselves”.

            Ashin was a poor monastic boy. This is where he met many young monks and novices growing up without good education and with a lack of human rights. He understood the importance of education and began his studies at a gratis school. He then became an essential guide for the young people. He has always wanted to help Burmese children with good education, and for them to understand human rights and democracy in Burma. This is why he continues to supports this monastery from the western world, where human rights and freedom from fear aid him in his quest. This school will continue to benefit from the proceeds of this book.

           There is a detailed description on Center LASANDAR which explains in full the concept of the center. Please free to visit the website for further information. For the moment, Lasandar remains open through subscriptions. This keeps the center running until donations through the book are received. All students of Lasandar will be able to donate with exchanges to continually improve its services and upkeep. In the future we hope to open a further free relaxation center in Burma or Asia for internships or training and retirement, and well-being in exotic countries, to make partnerships with monks, and also with Asian and European instructors.

             This Novel will be dispatched to you in e-book format for a donation of 10 dollars when it has reached its target of 8500 contributions. The 10 dollars donation will also be used for printing a soft back issue.

           A signed, soft back copy of Revolution of the Monks will be available to all at 25 dollars, which includes P&P,  e-book donators will be entitled to a 10 dollars discount on orders of the soft back, shipment will be within 90 days of placed orders.

             We would also like to ask you to please take the time to share this campaign with your friends and family, or anyone you know who would be interested in this novel. We thank you in advance for your participation.

Please Note:

              Anyone who contributes 850 dollars, or more, will receive as an exchange a signed copy of the book and e-book, and are welcome to come and practice ALL disciplines at center LASANDAR, this offer can be transferred to friends or family, please contact the CENTER LASANDAR.

Our Goal with this novel

1. After reading this book, people will be able keep it as a reference. It is useful for philosophers, sociology students, politicians, diplomats etc… and for people interested in Buddhism. Everybody will benefit and will also have a better understanding of Burma. That’s what we want to give to the people with this book.

2. To publish Ashin’s literatures, which are written in Burmese and English.

3. We are now planning a film based on this novel with Doctor Aung (Screenwriter for the film THE MONK) and his production team in Burma, and with our production team in France, with the association of Lasandar (Relaxation center), Loïc Bricka (professional cameraman), and Steve Henderson (Professional Photographer). Some finances for this film will be used from the donations of this novel.

4. To start a new free well-being center and assist the center already running in Burma.

Why Crowd Funding, Indiegogo?

                  We have been fortunate to have been able to finance the majority of this Novel up until now, but we need your help so that we can put the finishing touches on the project and publish. Six years of working on this project and we are almost there.

                   We are now turning to you, the audience: non-Buddhists, Buddhists, and spiritual seekers alike, and are appealing to your generosity in the hope that, with your support, we will be able to realize this dream.

References

  • The biography of ASHIN
  • Main points and accounts in Revolution of the Monks
  • Film  THE MONK  , main character  inspired by Ashin
  • THE CONVERSATION WITH FORMER BUDDHIST MONK , A short video about the Center Lasandar and Revolution of the Monks
  • A SHORT DOCUMENTARY OF ASHIN, realized by Loïc Bricka (professional cameraman) 
  • Saffron Revolution

Interview


Question (Ashin): Now you have finished reading my novel, what are your first impressions?

Answer (Steve): After reading your novel ‘Revolution of the Monks’ I thought it would be based more on the politics and structure of the revolution, but I found it more about your personal experiences and lifestyle during the protests.

Question (Ashin): So, you found that I used the revolution as a background for my experiences?

Answer (Steve): Yes, I found it more about your reactions and emotions to your personal situations.

Question (Ashin): Were there any surprises in the book and has it changed your feelings towards the monks?

Answer (Steve): Yes, It defiantly changed my perceived ideas of how Burmese monks lived, but in general, No. it has not changed my views towards them.

Question (Ashin): After reading about me in this book, do you think that I was a monk who did not obey the rules of the monks?

Answer (Steve): In general, No. I think you explained very well throughout the book that the thoughts and experiences of the Burmese monks were different to what us in the west perceived they were.

Question (Ashin): After reading my book, what did you get out of it, has it changed your perceptions?

Answer (Steve): Yes, I felt it has changed my perceptions on how the Burmese monks lived, and also very very interesting reading about the differences in the culture and politics in Burma at that time.

Question (Ashin): After we published this book, do you think that I will be in the dangerous situation? For example, the Buddhist monks and the Burmese government will feel angry with what I wrote in this book? Even though I had been living in a monastery since I was 3 years old. Also, I have the proof for that?

Answer (Steve): Well I can’t speak for their side. In the west, we will see you more as a person, a human being.

Question (Steve): In your book, I found you were quite hard, and possibly aggressive towards the police and military services. In the west we look on these services for protection, but in Burma your accounts are not so?

Answer (Ashin): I don’t think the aggressive words used in this book against the military and police are offensive to them. Now, I will explain to you who the military and police are in Burma. They have had poor education at that time in Burma. Now, I do not know exactly. but there are not a lot of changes. I have been in France for 6 years. Since I was 3 years old, my parents left me in a monastery. Time to time I visited to the village of my parents. Around the village there were soldiers and police. Sometimes I had the conversations with them. Through talking with them I found out they had not had a good education. In Burma there are two ways you can become a soldier, the first way is, when you finish your high school level, you will receive the papers and can enroll in the DSA Defense Services Academy School and become an officer. Normally if you finish your examination like the BAC in France, the students have learned about the human rights and team work and to think about what their rights are and what is their responsibility. But, the education system in Burma is not like in Europe, many children, students, are not honest with their exams and because of good contacts, they can enter into DSA Defense Services Academy School with a low education. Because of this they are not able to decide what is right or what is wrong, or what is good or what is bad. But being an officer means having power, can be someone important, be the president in Burma. Even my master, he wanted me to be an officer in the military, to become president or someone important in Burma, that’s why many people would like to attend the military university to become an officer. They don’t really know what their responsibility is. They want to be an officer in military just for the power, the second type is that they join the military at very young ages, 13, 14, 15 years old. Most soldiers are around 20/25 years old. So many soldiers are uneducated kids, there are recruiters who try to get kids to join the army. These children are from poor uneducated families and hang out on the streets. Because of this I think they will not take offence of my words in this book, also they know this is true and a reality of their life and also they do not like their lives in military. I have to describe them like this because this is the way it is in Burma. When I describe them like this, for western people it comes across as harsh because here in Europe there are military and police to protect you.

Question (Steve): Why did you entitle your book “Revolution of the Monks?”

Answer (Ashin). Firstly, I chose the title ‘Revolution of the Monks’ because this protest gave me an idea to write this book, secondly, it implies about change, personal and psychological change within a monk, it is about how I changed my way of thinking, traditions and my monk lifestyle. So it is because of these two reasons that I titled this novel. This is not a biography as it only relates to the time of the protests in Burma. After reading this book you now have an understanding of the personal revolution of monks, many that had left Burma, like me, to lead normal lives in other countries. For example, I am not a monk anymore. Many monks in Burma do not want to be monks anymore but they are afraid to be poor in civil lives. So they are still monks. Me, I have made a change or you could say a revolution of my monk life.

Question (Steve): My last question is, why did you decide to write this book, what was your goal, or incentive?

Answer (Ashin): Well, after the revolution of the monks I moved to the frontier. I had many struggles and rested in a town at the Thai/Burma border called Maesot. There I met some monks, who were also in the revolution. They were not writers or artists. They live a normal monks life. me, I am a writer, even though I did not publish anything in Burma, I loved to write poetry, novels and articles, Like my books ‘The Eight Path Ways for Life’ it is a philosophy book in English and ‘A Visit to a Meditation Centre with a Spanish woman’ this is also long novel which I had written in Burma before the revolution. I had 2 reasons to write this book. Firstly as I am a writer, I cannot live without writing during 9, 10 months at the border. Secondly, when we arrived at the border, many journalists came and ask a lot of questions to the monks and people. I heard some monks talk about their personal emotions regarding this revolution. But, they did not remember any more about the revolution in detail. Me, I have noted the dates and the situation about our revolution as soon as I arrived at the border. I knew exactly how the revolution was started, why? Because there were small community among me and my colleague monks and Moe Nyein , this is not his real name, he was a young boy. We did not see each other all the time but we knew what each other were doing. That’s why finally I found out who U Gambira is, he became famous, very famous after the revolution of the monks. What I want to say is that many monks gave interviews but they could not give the background behind the revolution, or many details. Me, I was not very famous, but it was me which was working at the back. But I hid from the media, I did not want to be famous and also I did not want to be in the media, because I lived close to Shwedagone Pagoda. In this area, all the police and people knew me before starting the revolution because I was with the tourists many times on the street. And also I did not think that one day I could be at the border. I wanted to have a good life in Burma but our country was very poor because of the military government. That’s why me and other my colleague monks exploded our emotions at that time. I was an organizer from behind the revolution. I gave many suggestions to the other monk leaders, so it’s only me who knows all the details regarding the revolution. The people who were involved did not know all the details on how the revolution started. But they made many interviews afterwards because they were famous, they are close to the media, they are politicians. So I decided to write about this revolution or everybody will forget our revolution and get wrong information. Even Wikipedia, they could only write down the limited information which they had from the people, who were in the revolution, but nobody knows the details. In the book I mix my personal life and the revolution. I am sure that all western people like Buddhist philosophy, Even if they don’t know the living style of monks in Burma. I don’t think they will look down on Buddhism and on other monks because of this book. But some of them will look down on me a little for sure. But, I don’t care for this because I am not a monk anymore in Europe. I liked my life in the monastery because I lived in a monastery for 22 years and the monastery has stayed in my heart, and also I have many gratitude to the monastery. I just want to tell the reality in this book. So I would like to say that I write this book, not to attack, I was a freeman when I wrote it, and I’m not standing at the side of politicians who are against the military government or at the side of the monks either. I don’t want to tell lies about the revolution.

My incentive of this book is, after reading this book, everybody will keep it in their library and this book is very very very useful for everybody. This book, for example is for the philosophers and sociology students, politicians and diplomat and all people who are interested in Burmese culture and Buddhism. I think everybody will get something from this book and also they will have a better understanding of Burma and Buddhism, that’s what I want to give to the people with this book.

 Thank you to all involved in the project of revolution of the monks (Ashin)
story_txt:
Revolution of the Monks


RealizationAuthor – Ashin (saffron revolution monk leader)Country – Myanmar & FranceLanguage – Burmese, English, FrenchSeries – CultureGenre – NovelPublisher – In house (self-published author)Publishing date – 2015Media type – E-book, Print (Softback)Purchase (direct) - Buy on Amazon.comPages – 204Product Dimensions – 5.1 x 0.5 x 7.8 inchesShipping Weight – 9.9 ouncesISBN – 9782953747003
Crew
- Writer - Ashin, version Burmese. - Premier version edited into English by Doctor Aung Min, screenwriter of film (THE MONK), and his wife, - Book edits media design - Steve Henderson (Professional Photographer) and Daniel Massidda (Graphic Designer)-Site
Designer - Mr. Bernard Banoviez (Informatician)Main Characters


- U Yevata (Ashin Yevata, writer and main
character of novel)
- Aurélie (French love interest)
- Mr. Lothar Kinzemmann (Mr.L) German friend of Ashin
- U Gambira (U Sandawbarsa, arrested after
the revolution)
- Doctor Aung Min (AM ) Screenwriter for the film (THE MONK) 
- Aung San Suu Kyi (1991 Nobel peace prize
winner)
- U Agga (Chulalongkorn University in Thailand,
a friend of Ashin)
- Zarganar (Famous Burmese comedian)
- Kyaw Thu (Famous Burmese actor)
- U Sandarsiri(a) Payit  (Monk from Maggin monastery, arrested after
the saffron revolution)What is the Revolution of the Monks ?           This novel is
based on the Saffron Revolution of the Burmese Monks which took place in Burma
(Myanmar), September 2007. Ashin Yevata was one of the monk leaders in the
protest just before the Tibetan unrest in 2008. Burma
had been under military dictatorship for 60 years. These are his accounts
during the Saffron revolution for the liberty of the Burmese people, and also
his personal revolution. 
The Story

            REVOLUTION OF THE MONKS is a personal journey of a Buddhist Monk through the protests in Myanmar (Burma) 2007. The book describes events of the protests against dictatorship, personal relationships and thoughts and feelings of a practicing monk.As a Former Burmese Buddhist Monk, he decided to write about his role in the Revolution of the Monks and share an insight into his personal life during the Revolution of 2007, Political and Military participation in the protests, and their personal and cultural differences.   This book was written in Thailand 2008 while waiting to enter Europe, his goal was to record information on the Revolution so this piece of history was not lost.It has been six years in the making with translations from Burmese to English, French, Spanish and German.Why We Need Your Help            The purpose of this book is to raise donations to realize his dream of
running a free, gratis, Wellbeing Center. The doors will be open to all. Why do
this? Ashin would like to make exchanges with students, free from constraints
of money, this provides good morality and honest participations, this also
ensures the less fortunate among us have the opportunity to attend the center. Another benefit will be a
school already opened by Ashin in Burma, where young monks and local children
learn to read and write and speak foreign languages, to aid in the advancement
of themselves.               This is a monastic school where
Ashin taught English language to the candidates, monks and novices who don’t
have parent at gratis monastic school.
 If you would like to meet the
students in Yangon, you can join us on our visit or go to directly yourself to
(Kaytumadi monastery, Mayangone Township Yangon, Myanmar)Our slogan is “help others by
helping ourselves”.
            Ashin was a poor monastic boy.
This is where he met many young monks and novices growing up without good
education and with a lack of human rights. He understood the importance of
education and began his studies at a gratis school. He then became an essential
guide for the young people. He has always wanted to help Burmese children with
good education, and for them to understand human rights and democracy in Burma.
This is why he continues to supports this monastery from the western world, where human rights and freedom from fear aid him in his quest. This school will continue to benefit from the proceeds of
this book.           There is a detailed description on Center LASANDAR which explains in full the concept of the center. Please free to visit the website for further information. For the moment, Lasandar remains open through subscriptions. This keeps the center running until donations through the book are received. All students of Lasandar will be able to donate with exchanges to continually improve its services and upkeep. In the future we hope to open a further free relaxation center in Burma or Asia for internships or training and retirement, and well-being in exotic countries, to make partnerships with monks, and also with Asian and European instructors.             This Novel will be dispatched to you in e-book format for a donation of 10 dollars when it has reached its target of 8500 contributions. The 10 dollars donation will also be used for printing a soft back issue.            A signed, soft back copy of Revolution of the Monks will be available to all at 25 dollars, which includes P&P,  e-book donators will be entitled to a 10 dollars discount on orders of the soft back, shipment will be within 90 days of placed orders.             We would also like to ask you to please take the time to share this campaign with your friends and family, or anyone you know who would be interested in this novel. We thank you in advance for your participation.Please Note:               Anyone who contributes 850 dollars, or
more, will receive as an exchange a signed copy of the book and e-book, and are
welcome to come and practice ALL disciplines at center LASANDAR, this offer can
be transferred to friends or family, please contact the CENTER LASANDAR.

Our Goal with this novel1.	After reading this book, people will be able keep it as a reference.  It is useful for philosophers, sociology students, politicians, diplomats etc… and for people interested in Buddhism. Everybody will benefit and will also have a better understanding of Burma. That’s what we want to give to the people with this book.2.	To publish Ashin’s literatures, which are written in Burmese and English.3.	We are now planning a film based on this novel with Doctor Aung (Screenwriter for the film THE MONK) and his production team in Burma, and with our production team in France, with the association of Lasandar (Relaxation center), Loïc Bricka (professional cameraman), and Steve Henderson (Professional Photographer). Some finances for this film will be used from the donations of this novel.4.      To start a new free well-being center and assist the center already running in Burma.Why Crowd Funding, Indiegogo?                  We have been fortunate to have been able to finance the majority of this Novel up until now, but we need your help so that we can put the finishing touches on the project and publish. Six years of working on this project and we are almost there.                   We are now turning to you, the audience: non-Buddhists, Buddhists, and spiritual seekers alike, and are appealing to your generosity in the hope that, with your support, we will be able to realize this dream.  References
The biography of ASHIN 

Main points and accounts in Revolution of the Monks

Film  THE MONK  , main character  inspired by Ashin


THE CONVERSATION WITH FORMER BUDDHIST MONK , A short video about the Center Lasandar and Revolution of the Monks


A SHORT DOCUMENTARY OF ASHIN, realized by Loïc Bricka (professional cameraman) 


Saffron Revolution

InterviewQuestion (Ashin): Now you have finished reading my novel, what are your first impressions?Answer (Steve):  After reading your novel ‘Revolution of the Monks’ I thought it would be based more on the politics and structure of the revolution, but I found it more about your personal experiences and lifestyle during the protests.Question (Ashin):  So, you found that I used the revolution as a background for my experiences?Answer (Steve):   Yes, I found it more about your reactions and emotions to your personal situations.Question (Ashin):  Were there any surprises in the book and has it changed your feelings towards the monks?Answer (Steve):   Yes, It defiantly changed my perceived ideas of how Burmese monks lived, but in general, No. it has not changed my views towards them.Question (Ashin):  After reading about me in this book, do you think that I was a monk who did not obey the rules of the monks?Answer (Steve):    In general, No. I think you explained very well throughout the book that the thoughts and experiences of the Burmese monks were different to what us in the west perceived they were.Question (Ashin):    After reading my book, what did you get out of it, has it changed your perceptions?Answer (Steve): Yes, I felt it has changed my perceptions on how the Burmese monks lived, and also very very interesting reading about the differences in the culture and politics in Burma at that time.  Question (Ashin):  After we published this book, do you think that I will be in the dangerous situation? For example, the Buddhist monks and the Burmese government will feel angry with what I wrote in this book? Even though I had been living in a monastery since I was 3 years old. Also, I have the proof for that?Answer (Steve): Well I can’t speak for their side. In the west, we will see you more as a person, a human being.  Question (Steve): In your book, I found you were quite hard, and possibly   aggressive towards the police and military services. In the west we look on these services for protection, but in Burma your accounts are not so?Answer (Ashin):      I don’t think the aggressive words used in this book against the military and police are offensive to them. Now, I will explain to you who the military and police are in Burma. They have had poor education at that time in Burma. Now, I do not know exactly. but there are not a lot of changes. I have been in France for 6 years. Since I was 3 years old, my parents left me in a monastery. Time to time I visited to the village of my parents. Around the village there were soldiers and police. Sometimes I had the conversations with them. Through talking with them I found out they had not had a good education. In Burma there are two ways you can become a soldier, the first way is, when you finish your high school level, you will receive the papers and can enroll in the DSA Defense Services Academy School and become an officer. Normally if you finish your examination like the BAC in France, the students have learned about the human rights and team work and to think about what their rights are and what is their responsibility. But, the education system in Burma is not like in Europe, many children, students, are not honest with their exams and because of good contacts, they can enter into DSA Defense Services Academy School with a low education. Because of this they are not able to decide what is right or what is wrong, or what is good or what is bad. But being an officer means having power, can be someone important, be the president in Burma. Even my master, he wanted me to be an officer in the military, to become president or someone important in Burma, that’s why many people would like to attend the military university to become an officer. They don’t really know what their responsibility is. They want to be an officer in military just for the power, the second type is that they join the military at very young ages, 13, 14, 15 years old. Most soldiers are around 20/25 years old. So many soldiers are uneducated kids, there are recruiters who try to get kids to join the army. These children are from poor uneducated families and hang out on the streets. Because of this I think they will not take offence of my words in this book, also they know this is true and a reality of their life and also they do not like their lives in military. I have to describe them like this because this is the way it is in Burma. When I describe them like this, for western people it comes across as harsh because here in Europe there are military and police to protect you.  Question (Steve): Why did you entitle your book “Revolution of the Monks?”  Answer (Ashin).  Firstly, I chose the title ‘Revolution of the Monks’ because this protest gave me an idea to write this book, secondly, it implies about change, personal and psychological change within a monk, it is about how I changed my way of thinking, traditions and my monk lifestyle. So it is because of these two reasons that I titled this novel. This is not a biography as it only relates to the time of the protests in Burma. After reading this book you now have an understanding of the personal revolution of monks, many that had left Burma, like me, to lead normal lives in other countries. For example, I am not a monk anymore. Many monks in Burma do not want to be monks anymore but they are afraid to be poor in civil lives. So they are still monks. Me, I have made a change or you could say a revolution of my monk life. Question (Steve): My last question is, why did you decide to write this book, what was your goal, or incentive? Answer (Ashin):  Well, after the revolution of the monks I moved to the frontier. I had many struggles and rested in a town at the Thai/Burma border called Maesot. There I met some monks, who were also in the revolution. They were not writers or artists. They live a normal monks life.  me, I am a writer, even though I did not publish anything in Burma, I loved to write poetry, novels and articles, Like my books ‘The Eight Path Ways for Life’ it is a philosophy book in English and ‘A Visit to a Meditation Centre with a Spanish woman’ this is also long novel which I had written in Burma before the revolution.  I had 2 reasons to write this book. Firstly as I am a writer, I cannot live without writing during 9, 10 months at the border.  Secondly, when we arrived at the border, many journalists came and ask a lot of questions to the monks and people. I heard some monks talk about their personal emotions regarding this revolution. But, they did not remember any more about the revolution in detail. Me, I have noted the dates and the situation about our revolution as soon as I arrived at the border. I knew exactly how the revolution was started, why? Because there were small community among me and my colleague monks and Moe Nyein , this is not his real name, he was a young boy. We did not see each other all the time but we knew what each other were doing. That’s why finally I found out who U Gambira is, he became famous, very famous after the revolution of the monks. What I want to say is that many monks gave interviews but they could not give the background behind the revolution, or many details. Me, I was not very famous, but it was me which was working at the back. But I hid from the media, I did not want to be famous and also I did not want to be in the media, because I lived close to Shwedagone Pagoda. In this area, all the police and people knew me before starting the revolution because I was with the tourists many times on the street. And also I did not think that one day I could be at the border. I wanted to have a good life in Burma but our country was very poor because of the military government. That’s why me and other my colleague monks exploded our emotions at that time. I was an organizer from behind the revolution. I gave many suggestions to the other monk leaders, so it’s only me who knows all the details regarding the revolution. The people who were involved did not know all the details on how the revolution started.  But they made many interviews afterwards because they were famous, they are close to the media, they are politicians. So I decided to write about this revolution or everybody will forget our revolution and get wrong information. Even Wikipedia, they could only write down the limited information which they had from the people, who were in the revolution, but nobody knows the details.  In the book I mix my personal life and the revolution. I am sure that all western people like Buddhist philosophy, Even if they don’t know the living style of monks in Burma. I don’t think they will look down on Buddhism and on other monks because of this book. But some of them will look down on me a little for sure. But, I don’t care for this because I am not a monk anymore in Europe. I liked my life in the monastery because I lived in a monastery for 22 years and the monastery has stayed in my heart, and also I have many gratitude to the monastery. I just want to tell the reality in this book. So I would like to say that I write this book, not to attack, I was a freeman when I wrote it, and I’m not standing at the side of politicians who are against the military government or at the side of the monks either.  I don’t want to tell lies about the revolution.My incentive of this book is, after reading this book, everybody will keep it in their library and this book is very very very useful for everybody.  This book, for example is for the philosophers and sociology students, politicians and diplomat and all people who are interested in Burmese culture and Buddhism. I think everybody will get something from this book and also they will have a better understanding of Burma and Buddhism, that’s what I want to give to the people with this book.  Thank you to all involved in the project of revolution of the monks (Ashin)

story:
Who am I?

My name is Mark and I'm a young boy from Europe, Czech republic. Maybe my age is low, but my ambitions and visions are pointing to the stars. I didn't have an easy life, my childhood was full of fear and watching my parents as the worst examples in how to live right. They never believed in my big dreams and ambitions, it was always too unreal to imagine for them, that something like this could be possible. Last year they divorced and I started with investing to myself - I have read many of books about personal growth, I visited lot of seminars and I started to meet people with the same meaning like me. Now I've got  very special and unique know-how and I really want to share it with the others.

My campaign?
 

This campaign is very important for me. I feel it like an obligation - to share my knowledge about personal growing with whole world, because people are blind, people don't see these opportunities around them and maybe they even don't want to see it. That's the reason why they will never chase their dreams and goals and why they will be sad and unsatisfied forever. I want to change it and help them with building completely different mindset - different style of thinking. I want them to think big, to dream big. Because with this mindset is everything possible.

My book should be about - you can achieve anything you set your mind to - in any age, in any place, whoever you are, however hard times did you have. You can do it. Do you have any dreams? So follow them and chase them. No matter if you're 16 years old or 100.

What I Need & What You Get

I chose the flexible funding, because there is no special amount that I dramatically need for chase my dream. Any amount of money, any help of you will help me and the whole world and I appreciate every dollar from you.
Money from this fund will be used for publishing, translating to other languages, printingthe book and so on, but also money which will left (if this crowdfunding is going to be successful), I'm going to invest them. Each dollar will be invested the best way - to my own business and to stocks. It may sounds crazy, but to be honest - I want to be absolutely opened to you - My project is on the beggining and I need money for things like publishing and giving to my book the physical form, but also I need money to "buy some time" to be absolutely focused only to my project. Money that will left I'm going to invest them, because it will help me to become a real millionaire from a student.

The Impact

Your contribution can help me but even the whole world. I'm persuaded  that my book can leave here very big legacy. My book is going to be valuable for you and the rest of the world from one special reason - My know-how is a big combination from the most famous people from the wordl like Thomas Edison, Napoleon Hill, Jack Canfield, Brian Tracy, Robin Sharma, Grant Cardone and people that their books and their knowledge changed the world. I'm not going to copy them, I'm going to write about my personal and very successful experience with knowledge from these people - and I want o show the world that anyone can do it, anyone can achieve it - in any age,.... I see my big value in my low age, because when people will see a young man writing about his personal results with this mindset, I hope that they will think about changing their mindsets too. If a 20 years old boy did it, whoever can do it.

If you help me, you can help the world by touching millions of lives and also I'm sure that if you buy my book one day, you will be satisfied and blessed, that you helped me with this fung a long time ago.

Risks & Challenges

Of course that it's a big challenge for a young boy. To be honest, for me it's a biggest challenge in my life. But that's the reason why I'm doing it.  I love beating challenges, it's my passion. There may be lot of haters who won't trust me, but I'm not a person who cares about haters, I care about people who want to teach something more or who want to help, I care about people who are opened to my know-how. Any challenge is too big for me. Finishing this project is my deal and I'm going to finish it at any cost.

Other Ways You Can Help Me

Dear people, if my campaign wasn't enough attractive for you and you don't want to help me or you're not able to help me, you can help me just for example with saying to your friends or anyone else about this project. Let they know about me and maybe they wilb be exited to help me!

Thank you so much!

story:
My name is John Bunce, and I am a doctoral candidate in psychology at the University of California, Merced. In the wake of the recent tragedy at Umpqua Community College in Oregon, I was watching a segment by the Late Show with Stephen Colbert that discussed the roles of Honesty and Pretending in the modern political discourse. Particularly moving were Mr. Colbert’s thoughts concerning the national reaction to these horrific events; he accurately called attention to how we consistently respond to mass shootings by expressing shock and sadness, then we do nothing and act surprised when it happens again.

The time has come to change our collective response by taking decisive steps to pass responsible and enforceable firearm regulations.  This is why, with the support of a diverse collection of like-minded colleagues, I am seeking your support to establish the Firearms Undoubtedly Need Regulation Association (FUNRA), a political action committee for taking a direct stand against the powerful gun-rights lobby and advocating for sensible firearm regulation policy.  While this task may seem insurmountable, pretending that another mass shooting won’t happen is just plain insane. I can no longer reconcile my inaction with my conscience. Something must be done. Please help us take a stand to make this country safer for our children and all Americans.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funding in the amount of $15,000. This money would be used to create essential organizational infrastructure (e.g., to register with the appropriate government agencies, to build a website), to directly support pro-reform candidates in competitive races at the national and state level, and to develop a direct counter campaign that challenges the many groups obstructing the implementation of sensible reform, such as universal background checks. To spread FUNRA’s message, we will utilize multiple modes of advertising, including:

·  Video

·  Direct mail

·  Social media

·  Email

·  Media engagement

·  Event coordination

Several perks are planned to reward early FUNRA supporters. A contribution of $25.00 achieves Silver Status and FUNRA’s first bumper sticker. Donations of $100 are classified as Gold Status, and the contributor receives a FUNRA t-shirt and bumper sticker.

This is an all-or-nothing campaign, so if we fail to reach our goal, supporters will get their contributions back. We believe this funding represents the crucial amount necessary to ensure our ability to make a meaningful impact. We are committed to using at least 70% of all contributions to directly engage in campaigning for the gun regulation during the 2016 election cycle.

The Impact

Stop being a pretender, and help us establish the Firearms Undoubtedly Need Regulation Association to take a stand against needless gun violence. As a first step, FUNRA will work to pass legislation implementing universal background checks on the purchase of firearms nationwide. We believe closing the gun show and private sale loopholes will keep firearms out of the hands of those that might use them to harm others. After establishing the essential organizational infrastructure, FUNRA will begin a targeted digital media campaign in support of candidates who have committed to firearm law reform. After completing this stated goal, FUNRA will continue its mission to support the passage of sensible gun regulation by supporting tested measures that reduce violence, address mental health concerns, and ensure the safety of all citizens.  The founding members of FUNRA have backgrounds in psychology, social services, community activism, public health, statistics, and video production, providing the organization with a diverse toolkit to face the challenges posed by gun violence in our society.

Risks & Challenges

The real risk lies in doing nothing, and the challenges those in support of ending the violence face are very clear. The issue of firearm regulation evokes passionate responses from people on both sides of the debate, and the firearms industry and others heavily fund the gun-rights lobby.  However, there is common ground. Millions of Americans support universal background checks, mandatory storage restrictions, and tighter regulation of gun dealers. FUNRA will seek progress in these areas. We believe that, by targeting areas of agreement, we can affect actual legislative change. The people of this country cannot continue to allow politicians on both sides of the aisle to block regulations supported by the majority of Americans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing is not the only way you can support the creation of the Firearms Undoubtedly Need Regulation Association. Please take a moment to spread the word about FUNRA by sharing our campaign with your friends and contacts. Let’s stop pretending things will change and do something. Help us start a movement dedicated to sensible firearm law reform.

level, and to develop a direct counter campaign that challenges the many groups obstructing
the implementation of sensible reform, such as universal background checks. To spread
FUNRA’s message, we will utilize multiple modes of advertising, including:
· 
Video 
· 
Direct mail 
· 
Social media
· 
Email
· 
Media engagement
· 
Event coordination 
Several perks are planned to reward early FUNRA supporters. A
contribution of $25.00 achieves Silver Status and FUNRA’s first bumper sticker.
Donations of $100 are classified as Gold Status, and the contributor receives a
FUNRA t-shirt and bumper sticker.
This is an all-or-nothing campaign, so if we fail to reach our
goal, supporters will get their contributions back. We believe this funding
represents the crucial amount necessary to ensure our ability to make a
meaningful impact. We are committed to using at least 70% of all contributions
to directly engage in campaigning for the gun regulation during the 2016
election cycle.
The Impact
Stop being a pretender, and help us establish the Firearms
Undoubtedly Need Regulation Association to take a stand against needless gun
violence. As a first step, FUNRA will work to pass legislation implementing
universal background checks on the purchase of firearms nationwide. We believe
closing the gun show and private sale loopholes will keep firearms out of the
hands of those that might use them to harm others. After establishing the
essential organizational infrastructure, FUNRA will begin a targeted digital
media campaign in support of candidates who have committed to firearm law
reform. After completing this stated goal, FUNRA will continue its mission to
support the passage of sensible gun regulation by supporting tested measures
that reduce violence, address mental health concerns, and ensure the safety of
all citizens.  The founding members of
FUNRA have backgrounds in psychology, social services, community activism, public
health, statistics, and video production, providing the organization with a
diverse toolkit to face the challenges posed by gun violence in our society. 

Risks &
Challenges
The real risk lies in doing nothing, and the challenges those in
support of ending the violence face are very clear. The issue of firearm
regulation evokes passionate responses from people on both sides of the debate,
and the firearms industry and others heavily fund the gun-rights lobby.  However, there is common ground. Millions of
Americans support universal background checks, mandatory storage restrictions,
and tighter regulation of gun dealers. FUNRA will seek progress in these areas.
We believe that, by targeting areas of agreement, we can affect actual legislative
change. The people of this country cannot continue to allow politicians on both
sides of the aisle to block regulations supported by the majority of Americans.

Other Ways
You Can Help
Contributing is not the only way you can support the creation of
the Firearms Undoubtedly Need Regulation Association. Please take a moment to spread
the word about FUNRA by sharing our campaign with your friends and contacts.
Let’s stop pretending things will change and do something. Help us start a
movement dedicated to sensible firearm law reform.

story:
Hello :) I'm Ofer Hod, a family man with 3 boys, we live in Israel. I work as an animator and a multimedia designer and I'm also the writer and illustrator of the book "My Dad's Bald Head." With your help, it can be published!

It would be amazing for me if we could get this together. I really want to get this book out, and I want you to feel happy with the perks I can give you :)


First, Here is the complete video book, for online watching. Have fun :)


The funding I Need includes the actual publishing, printing of hardcover and softcover books, packaging (I won't use hard-to-be-recycled mailers) and shipping from Israel to your country. All perks include shipping.

I wanted to make the books very affordable for you, and the first numbers were dangerous for me, because I have to consider EVERY cost (including indiegogo’s fee and unpredictable problems that can arise). In addition, I've added a 20 percent profit for me :)

I’m happy that I feel good with the perks and their cost, and I hope you feel good about them as well.

http://gph.is/2cmhbLU

I remember the kids at my son's kindergarten noticing I'm bald (pointing at me and saying, "You're bald.”) That reminded me of myself as a child, thinking it was kind of a special or weird thing when I saw a bald head. And so I decided to write about it :)



I finished writing rather quickly. The illustrations took me much longer to accomplish...

 

they were done at least three times on and off for two years, until I finally got the art I like.


The book first came out in Hebrew, and after translating and making some illustration changes, it is ready to go, with your help, in English.


I'm always surprised when I hear a parent telling me that their kid can't put the book down. It's really wonderful to know that my story gives them a reason to laugh and smile. By the way, I hardly see a difference between children of bald dads and full-haired dads. They all just really love it.



(To be honest, at first my younger kid, Omer, was afraid of the grandma illustration, but now he is OK with it.)



If we make this campaign successful, it will give me a nice boost to finish my next very funny book.


Risks & Challenges

I will be checking that the printing comes out perfectly, and won't settle for any mistakes. 

I'll immediately send another copy if you tell me yours arrived damaged.

Basically, I can't emotionally afford an unhappy "customer", so I'll do whatever it takes to make sure you’re always pleased with the perks and the project. 


I NEED YOUR HELP! 

If you would like to help me publish this book, please donate to this campaign. It's great when people can help pledge, but if you can't pledge at this time, it doesn't mean you can't help. Please share my story via social media, email, and word of mouth to tell your friends about my campaign.


Thank you!!

story:
BASEBALL PANORAMA STORY

A few years ago I came across some vintage panoramic images on the Library of Congress website. These panoramic images contain three elements that have always fascinated me: baseball, photography, and history. If you feel the same way I do about these images, please join me in this completed project and help me share this book with the baseball world. Thank you.

Risks & Challenges

All challenges have been met. The book has been formatted and ready to go!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign with friends & family. Thank you!

story:
We are organizers in the current movement for the Liberation of all Black people with a sense of optimism around the possibilities of political education and story sharing - if we can just get those stories and those ideas out there. 

In January of 2019 LEFT OUT Magazine was conceptualized by activists, writers and organizers activated by and embedded in the Black Live Matter Movement - the latest explosion of Black Struggle in the last 50 years. It was our participation within this struggle for Black liberation, and in broader struggles for greater labor rights, within the electoral arena, and against the ravages of capitalism, that brought us in closer to a younger and diverse array of working class and poor Black people. The founders of LEFT OUT recognize that these Black folks in particular are seeking to narrate their own struggle for themselves, but have few platforms set up for serious debate and discussion. Left Out Magazine seeks to provide the space for the voices of a new generation of Leftist working class Black people, anti-racist activists and Black political thinkers.

OUR PROGRESS

In the past 4 months we have set up our editorial board, brought on a videographer and web designer, and continue to receive contributions from writers, poets, and political satirists, and academics, and activists engaged in struggle on the ground in their respective locales.

We have been humbled and heartened by the contributions we have gotten from supporters so far.  We are equally motivated by words of support and recognition of the importance of independent left Black publications and journalism in the current global political state of affairs.

So, we're happy to report that we are currently in pre-production for our first interview with plans for two additional video productions.  We have also started development of our website.  On December 3rd we will be launching our second phase of fundraising with fundraisers in cities across the country for Giving Tuesday.  So keep spreading the word, and keep an eye out for us!  

Left OUT magazine seeks to create more space for a new generation of Black working class and poor leftists, antiracist activists, political thinkers, and intellectuals.  By providing a space for the stories, experiences, and political and cultural analysis of Black working class people to marry with anti-racist, Black Leftist political thought on paper and online literature, we can challenge each other in our communities and challenge the status quo. Black people define culture socially and politically and LEFT OUT will be a tool for us to claim that space. 

What We Need & What You Get

To fund the publication of our magazine - which is the cost of production, shipping, and most importantly paying our contributing writers, videographer and website development - we are raising $3,000 starting this Giving Tuesday through February 2020.   

Anyone who donates will receive the first issue of LEFT OUT and their name in the acknowledgements section of the publication. Want to contribute, but not necessarily interested in receiving a copy of the magazine? Reach out to us about donating your issue or subscription. 

The Impact

For us, LEFT OUT Magazine follows a long line of Black left publications (like "The Crisis", and "The Crusader"). LEFT OUT  attempts to provide more independent space for the an array of Black working class and poor people to find one another, debate, and converse in order to advance the struggle for Black Liberation and the liberation of the entire working class and poor from capitalism.  From the ideas shared by poets, writers, and academics to reporting the stories of everyday experiences and struggles of working and poor Black people LEFT OUT Magazine seeks to be a bridge between ideas and struggle, influencing the conversations between Black people and contribute to grass roots struggle. We genuinely believe that each generation must advance its political project and pursue different approaches and perspectives. LEFT OUT Magazine is our contribution to the collective political project of fighting for a better world. Your contribution will help build the foundation of this platform. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to read through our story and learn about the vision we are bringing to life. Every bit of help counts! If you aren't able to donate, please:

Share this fundraiser and spread the word about this project, in real life and on social media

Follow us on social media:

Twitter: @LeftMag

Facebook: www.facebook.com/LeftOutMag

Instagram: @leftoutmag

Have words of encouragement or questions, concerns, or ideas? Please reach out to us at leftoutmag@gmail.com

story:
El ABC de las Telenovelas

El ABC de las Telenovelas es un homenaje a los melodramas mexicanos que marcaron la cultura pop. Utilizando el formato de un libro infantil de abecedario, las autoras hacen un repaso ilustrado de los personajes más entrañables de las telenovelas, haciendo así un recorrido por la cultura popular mexicana. 

El resultado es un homenaje a los villanos y héroes de las telenovelas clásicas y un divertido cuestionamiento sobre cómo estos han influenciado nuestras narrativas en la vida cotidiana. 

Quiénes somos:

Somos tres mujeres mexicanas que unimos nuestros talentos para crear un libro divertido sobre las telenovelas, pues que aunque a veces queramos negarlo, fueron parte importante de nuestra (mala) educación emocional. 

Mich Winters 

Radica en Colorado donde trabaja en la industria de IT, enfocada en lanzar startups y optimizar la experiencia de los clientes. Su inspiración para crear este libro es ayudar a diversas comunidades a cambio de entretener a los lectores,  generando así una interesante conversación. 

Andrea Alvarado 

Ilustradora y diseñadora gráfica originaria de Córdoba, Veracruz. Actualmente además de ilustrar, practica arte urbano con la técnica de wheatpaste. 

Cris Winters

Escritora. Se ha desempeñado como editora y colaboradora de distintas revistas. Es cofundadora de The Bucket List México. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes a cambio

Necesitamos juntar $3500.00 USD para imprimir, promocionar y distribuir el libro El ABC de las Telenovelas. 

Dona  $20.00 USD y recibe una copia del libro. 

Si donas más de $25.00 USD, además del libro, recibirás un paquete con 5 stickers con las imágenes de nuestros villanos favoritos. 

Si donas más de $35.00, además del libro y el paquete de stickers, tendrás acceso a un taller de ilustración impartido por Andrea Alvarado, talento detrás de las imágenes del libro. 

El impacto 

¡Sin ti no podemos lograrlo! Ayúdanos a publicar nuestro libro de forma independiente. Estamos seguras que juntos podemos hacer una realidad nuestro sueño. 

Riesgos y retos: 

Otras formas en que puedes ayudar

Tu apoyo es muy importante para nosotras. Si no puedes contribuir de forma monetaria, agradeceremos que nos ayudes a difundir nuestra campaña en redes sociales con los hashtags oficiales. Para llegar a la meta necesitamos hacer ruido y cada post ayuda. ¡Comparte nuestros contenidos!

story:
What this book is about:

Most books on starting a business or on entrepreneurship are dry. At best, they're exciting if you're fascinated (as I am) about how people become successful. This book is different. It's about adventure, both inside and outside the entrepreneurial world. 

There's none of the airy theorizing that characterizes most business books. Instead, you get step-by-step actionable advice for every stage of building your business. Keshav's observation of successes and failures and philosophy is that everything is a learning experience, even if you're not sure where you're headed. 

Why It's Worth Reading: 
Three reasons.

First, the book provides an insider's view of serial entrepreneurship and the adaptation of the mind required for the transition to occur. Stop rushing into entrepreneurship born from half-baked ideas, misguided theories, and other forms of self-delusion based on motivational speakers. 

Second, while this book is positioned as advice for people considering a shift into the entrepreneurial world, it's also a manifesto for a new way of thinking about the environment juxtaposing concepts with common familiar themes such as parenting, marriage, growing up and funerals.

Third, it is fun, at the author's expense.

Best Quotes:

"Entrepreneurship is a marathon of marathons"

"It's a trap"

"The pain of regret is many times more than the pain of failure"

The themes:

1.      When does one bootstrap a business? a.k.a. Stories from the “Thrift“

2.      How does one transition from a corporate career into the entrepreneurial world? a.k.a. Stories from the “Shift”

3.      How dealing with business partners is the same as Marriage? a.k.a. Stories from the “Rift“

4.      When does one start a business? a.k.a. Stories from the “Lift“

5.      When does one bury a business? a.k.a. Stories from the “Crypt“

6.      How building and running businesses is SIMILAR to Parenting? a.k.a. Stories from the “Pffffft“

7.      Mental health issues that entrepreneurs face in light of the challenges and how the Dad jokes get worse? (Evident from the Dad jokes)

More about the author:

Chennakeshav (Keshav) Adya is a versatile and resourceful business and technology professional with 20+ years of international corporate and entrepreneurial experience in building firms across sectors from a concept and leading global teams of 200+ spanning corporate finance advisory, international growth, M&A, technology delivery and fund-raising. 

Keshav is an Entrepreneur Mentor in Residence (EMiR) at London Business School and is supporting the school's experiential entrepreneurship activities for students and alumni who are interested in pursuing a career in entrepreneurship, whether launching or growing their own ventures.

Keshav holds an MBA from London Business School and an Engineering degree from VTU, India.

story:
How To Become Known, Liked & Trusted By Your Ideal Customer  - Get Referrals And Repeat Business - Develop The Parts Of Your Personality That Will Draw People To You Like A Magnet - Become Well Known In Your Community - Become A Person That Everyone Likes & Become A Trusted Resource

* This book provides you the ability to learn the secrets successful sales professionals use to become the "go to" person in their industry.

* EXCEPTIONAL! Become a person that everyone likes, by developing the parts of your personality that will draw people to you like a magnet.

* FAST RESULTS! Become a trusted resource that everyone trusts for advice when it's time to make a buying decision just like the pros do.

* PROVEN! Time tested strategies to connect better with people, because all things being equal, people buy from those they know like and trust.

* TRUSTED! Now you can be confident that your clients will buy your products and services and you will see your commissions go through the roof. 

How To Become Known, Liked & Trusted By Your Ideal Customer is for every Sales Professional who wants to sell more products, but keeps wasting time because of unqualified buyers.

Here's a huge problem you face right now. You spend hours, days, or weeks wasting time with people who are unable or unwilling to buy. What makes this even worse is the fact that after you’ve spent all of this time, they buy from someone else! Which means you don't make any commissions.

You’ve been told that sales is just a numbers game. You have to keep knocking on strangers' doors and making cold calls.  But what if there was a shortcut, a way to turn the tables on this process and deal only with people you already have a relationship with, and who fit the profile of your ideal customer. That’s exactly what this book will show you, how to make and keep strong connections with enough people to keep your pipeline full without cold calling or knocking on doors. 

So, if you're a Sales Professional who really wants to sell more products, keeps wasting time because of unqualified or unready buyers, "How To Become Known, Liked & Trusted By Your Ideal Customer" is the answer you've been looking for!

Don't miss this opportunity to learn how to become the person everyone trusts for advice when it's time to make a buying decision! - Pre-Order Now!
